title: Cyber Security Manager
description:
**About us**



Working in the KPMG Cyber Security team, you will be part of a global organization working within various industries and areas, together with competent and inspiring colleagues. Our Cyber Security team enables our clients in their digital transformation journeys by identifying and remediating their cyber related risks. We work shoulder-to-shoulder with executive management, and we always seek digital, innovative, and sustainable solutions to our clients’ challenges.



You will be part of our Cyber Security team which consists of a tight knit group of specialists collaborating and sharing experiences on a daily basis. At KPMG, you will play a role in our global team of experts providing advisory services within Cyber security, Strategy and Governance, ISMS design and implementation, IAM, Forensic investigations, Operational Resilience, IT-due diligence and more.



We will support you in your journey and ensure that you find a fast-paced environment filled with brilliant colleagues. KPMG is consistently awarded top ranks within the cyber security field via external firms, this is something we are very proud of and keen to maintain. The Cyber team of approximately 50 colleagues is part of KPMGs Risk Consulting practice, a social and familiar group of about 130 colleagues with broad competence and expertise within advisory services across multiple sectors.



**Your role**


* Develop strong business relationships and demonstrate technical and operational leadership to deliver client-centric solutions with high quality.
* Effectively manage the commercial and contractual aspects of an engagement to achieve expected levels of client satisfaction, quality and profitability.
* Identify new opportunities and develop these within our existing customers.
* Continuously contribute to developing the team’s awareness regarding cyber insights, market trends, innovative products and services.
* Coach and provide constructive feedback and training to the junior team members to support their development journey.

  
**Skills & Requirements**
-------------------------


**We are looking for** a passionate, forward-thinking, business minded, consultancy-oriented security professional with at least six years of experience within Cyber Security. Key domains could include but not limited to areas below


* Cyber Security Strategy, Risk and Governance
* Information Security Management System design and implementation
* Identity and Access Management as well as Privileged Access Management
* Cyber Defense and Response (Penetration testing, red teaming, threat intelligence, incident response, digital forensics and malware analysis)
* Cloud Security
* Data Privacy
* Operational Resilience
* IT-due diligence


We will highly appreciate if you:


* Have previous consulting experience.
* Are a high performer with strong drive and high ambition.
* Are a team player with a genuine interest in helping colleagues and customers alike to grow and develop.
* Are fluent in Swedish & English.
* Hold relevant certifications such as CISM, CISSP, CISA, CRISC, CEH, OSCP, CCSP, ISO 27001 etc.
* Are used to working in an international context with cross border engagements.


**Want to make a difference with us?**



Apply by submitting your CV as soon as possible. Don’t wait with your application as we review applications and are hiring on a rolling basis. If you have any questions about the position, please don’t hesitate to contact Head of Cyber Security Visar Lapashtica, visar.lapashtica@kpmg.se For any questions related to the recruitment process please contact Talent Manager Lasma Indrijaite, lindrijaite@kpmg.com



**We look forward to your application and** for new colleagues to join our team!



**About the company**
---------------------


KPMG is a company for people who want to make a difference. We are one of the world’s leading professional services companies and a partner our clients depend on in the fast-paced world they are a part of. We provide insight and guidance on their journeys. This may mean organizational change for their company as a whole, or just parts of it. It may relate to their working methods, how to deal with potential risks, cyber threats or how to maximize user experience in a digitized world. We are also experts in analysis, M&A, auditing and tax to name just a few of our professional skills.

  


At KPMG, we work actively to maintain diversity and gender equality throughout the organization. Diversity brings perspectives that enrich our culture and add value for our clients and society alike. We believe in an inclusive culture that respects people for who they are and allows them to be themselves. Because this is at the heart of what we believe, we welcome applicants with different backgrounds and experiences.



In Sweden you will have 1,650 colleagues and 350 more in Lithuania and Latvia, which means there are 2,000 of us in the company. You will be part of KPMG’s worldwide network of more than 200,000 people.
company_description: At KPMG, you'll be able to tap into your skills, expertise and passion to help organizations find sustainable solutions to the world's most pressing issues.

title: 2nd Line Support och Incident Manager Göteborg
description:
Dina arbetsuppgifter
  
För vår klient söker vi en 2nd Line Support och Incident Manager. Detta är ett kort konsultuppdrag på 100% med placering i Göteborg där kunden har sitt kontor på Lindholmen. Kunden söker någon som kan starta omgående och arbeta fram till 31 decemeber 2024.
  
  

Denna position spelar en nyckelroll i att stödja avancerade molnteknologier (GCP och AWS) och hantera anslutningsproblem för mobilnätoperatörer (MNO) inom fordonssektorn.
  
  

**Huvudsakliga Ansvarsområden:**  

* Tillhandahålla 2nd line teknisk support för molnmiljöer (GCP, AWS) och säkerställa robusta anslutningslösningar i samarbete med MNO.
* Proaktivt hantera incidenter, med målet att snabbt lösa och minimera störningar.
* Samarbeta med interna team för att optimera systemets prestanda och stabilitet.
* Behålla omfattande dokumentation av alla tekniska frågor och lösningar.
* Engagera dig i kontinuerligt lärande för att förbli skicklig inom de senaste teknologierna.


**Kvalifikationer för rollen:****Teknisk Kompetens:**  

* Erfarenhet av molntjänster som Google Cloud Platform (GCP) och Amazon Web Services (AWS).
* Kännedom om mobilnätoperatör (MNO) anslutning och relaterade teknologier.
* Kunskap om telematiksystem och hur de integreras med fordons-teknologier.


**Erfarenhet:**  

* Tidigare erfarenhet av en 2nd line support-roll, hantering av incidenthantering och teknisk supportuppgifter.
* Praktisk erfarenhet av felsökning och lösa komplexa tekniska och anslutningsproblem, inklusive de som är relaterade till telematikenheter och programvara.
* Erfarenhet av att tillhandahålla exceptionellt kundstöd, helst inom en teknisk eller fordonsmässig kontext.


**Utbildningsbakgrund:**  

* En examen i datavetenskap, informationsteknik eller ett relaterat område är att föredra.
* Ytterligare kurser eller utbildning inom telematik, fordons-teknologier eller kundservice är mycket fördelaktigt.


**Språkkunskaper:**  

* Flytande i svenska och engelska är ett krav.
* Behärska Mandarin är starkt meriterande.


**Personliga egenskaper:**  

* Stark analytisk och problem-lösningsförmåga
* Förmåga att prioritera flera projekt och arbeta strukturerat
* Ha förmågan att ta in ny information och våga testa nya innovativa lösningar
* Skicklig på att inge förtroende och att samarbeta med olika intressenter
* Utmärkta verbala och skriftliga kommunikationsfärdigheter.


Om oss
  
Sway Sourcing är ett modernt företag som rekryterar inom flera branscher på den svenska arbetsmarknaden. Vi matchar kandidaters kompetens och kunskap med företagets behov. Sway Sourcing har en företagsledning och personal med lång erfarenhet i rekryteringsbranschen, både som ägare och anställda. Vi har ett stort nätverk inom de branscher vi specialiserat oss inom och kan därför hitta de kandidater som snabbt blir en tillgång för företagen.

title: Senior Cloud and Security Architect
description:
At Boeing, we innovate and collaborate to make the world a better place. From the seabed to outer space, you can contribute to work that matters with a company where diversity, equity and inclusion are shared values. We’re committed to fostering an environment for every teammate that’s welcoming, respectful and inclusive, with great opportunity for professional growth. Find your future with us.

**Why Choose Boeing Digital Aviation:**


At Boeing Digital Aviation Solutions, you’ll be a part of a team that creates innovative digital solutions and analytics that drive the future and evolution of Digital Aviation and enable our customers to transform the way they do business. Using agile digital technology, our solutions optimize all aspects of the flight ecosystem including safety, environmental sustainability, and efficiency – delivering value and protecting our customers and the planet.

**Who We Are Looking For:**  

The Boeing Digital Aviation Solutions (DAS) Application Engineering Senior Cloud and Product Security Architect must have broad cloud and application security background with experience in leading the definition and implementation of secure architecture and coding best practices for cloud native, customer-facing software solutions. The candidate needs strong technology leadership, analytical skills, teamwork, and excellent communication skills. The candidate will need to communicate at different levels in the organization to other technical personnel, business leaders and customers. This role will drive best-in-class software security practices into the Application Engineering organization in support of DAS modernization efforts to bring market-leading solutions to our aviation customers.

**What You Will Do:**

* Develop and lead implementation of security architecture and secure coding standards and strategies for DAS software solutions.
* Contribute to the definition of overall DAS architecture security principles, guidelines, patterns, training, and standards.
* Drive adoption of DevSecOps practices into the software engineering organization by working directly with teams on implementation.
* Provide effective communication to business and technical community on security architecture topics.
* Perform security tool evaluations and make recommendations for adoption.
* Assess security impact of architectural decisions to product lifecycle.
* Lead the identification of design constraints and ensure architecture conforms to security requirements.
* Work across software engineering teams and architects for end to end alignment, process improvements and future designs.
* Contribute to the standard software artifacts including the Software Architecture Document, Software Architecture models and other standard artifacts.
* Work with customers to understand their security requirements.
* Ensure compliance with Boeing Information Security requirements.
* Collaborate with cloud service providers, Boeing InfoSec and Boeing Enterprise External Cloud teams to architect best-of-breed application security solutions across multiple clouds.
* Review internal and vendor artifacts for security architecture compliance.

 **What You Will Need:**  

* Bachelor’s degree or higher in related field
* Highly technical and analytical, possessing 10 or more years of IT implementation experience.
* 5+ years’ experience in IT security, compliance and risk management, including privacy, controls, etc.
* Hands-on technical expertise in Security Architecture, automation, integration, and deployment (DevSecOps).
* Strong verbal and written communications skills and ability to lead effectively across organizations.

  

**Additional Success Factors:*** Proven experience leading a globally distributed team
* Proven experience to research, advise, compare and recommend technology solutions; ability to demonstrate and maintain method of keeping current on new technologies
* Proven ability to deliver application and infrastructure security solutions in a multi-cloud environment
* DevSecOps automation best practices
* DFARS/FedRAMP/ITAR
* NIST Cybersecurity Framework
* ISO 27001
* Security Development Lifecycle
* AWS/Azure/GCP Security services
* Cloud Security monitoring process
* Certificate Management
* Threat modeling
* Dynamic and Static Application Security Testing (DAST & SAST)
* Software Composition Analysis

**Typical Education & Experience:**  

Education/experience typically acquired through advanced education (e.g. Bachelor) and typically 10 or more years' related work experience or an equivalent combination of education and experience (e.g. Master+6 years' related work experience)

 **Relocation:**  

Relocation assistance is not a negotiable benefit for this position. Candidates must live in the immediate area or relocate at their own expense.


This position is hybrid. This means that the selected candidate will be required to perform some work onsite 3 days a week. This is at the hiring team’s discretion and could potentially change in the future.

**Employer will not sponsor applicants for employment visa status.**


At Boeing, diversity, equity, and inclusion are enduring company values. We strive to live these values every day not only because it’s the right thing to do, but because our success depends on it. The company’s commitment to diversity and inclusion providing a work environment for all employees that is welcoming, respectful and equitable, with opportunities for personal and professional development.

 **Export Control Requirements:** Not an export control position **Equal Opportunity Employer:**


We are an equal opportunity employer. We do not accept unlawful discrimination in our recruitment or employment practices on any grounds including but not limited to; race, color, ethnicity, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, physical or mental disability, genetic factors, military and veteran status, or other characteristics covered by applicable law.


We have teams in more than 65 countries, and each person plays a role in helping us become one of the world’s most innovative, diverse and inclusive companies. We are proud members of the Valuable 500 and welcome applications from candidates with disabilities. Applicants are encouraged to share with our recruitment team any accommodations required during the recruitment process. Accommodations may include but are not limited to: conducting interviews in accessible locations that accommodate mobility needs, encouraging candidates to bring and use any existing assistive technology such as screen readers and offering flexible interview formats such as virtual or phone interviews.

title: Project Manager
description:
**Role:**  

The project is challenging and will require close collaboration between teams (Germany) and (Stockholm). The majority of the development takes place in Stockholm – the teams are highly motivated and skilled.


The ideal candidate has experience in high-volume, high-availability transaction processing. The project will be connected to backend infrastructures – (Mainframe Stockholm) and cloud-based solutions (primarily based on microservices in Java & KAFKA). Development is carried out by our agile teams – and collaboration with the agile methodology in a SaFE environment will be needed. Dedicated teams will not be available, but the project will have priority 1 for affected teams (after regulatory requirements and daily operations).


Excellent communication and collaboration skills are essential, as the process involves getting two organizations to work together. The focus will be on getting the job done, removing obstacles, rather than reporting, as close collaboration will take place with program management.

title: Dynamics 365 CE Consultant
description:
**Om Rollen:**

  

Som konsult inom Dynamics 365 Customer Engagement och Power Platform kommer du att spela en nyckelroll i att hjälpa våra kunder att designa och implementera lösningar som stöder deras affärsprocesser. Du kommer att arbeta nära kunderna för att förstå deras behov, översätta dessa till funktionella specifikationer och säkerställa att lösningarna levereras enligt de högsta standarderna. Din erfarenhet och expertis inom Power Platform (inklusive Power Apps och Power Automate) kommer att vara ovärderlig för att automatisera processer och effektivisera arbetssätt genom skräddarsydda applikationer.

  



Erfarenhet inom Power BI är starkt meriterande och kommer att hjälpa våra kunder att möjliggöra datadrivna beslut genom insiktsfulla rapporter och dashboards.

  


**Huvudsakliga** **a****nsvarsområden:**

  

* Analysera och förstå kundernas affärsprocesser och behov.
* Designa, konfigurera och implementera Dynamics 365 Customer Engagement- och Power Platform-lösningar.
* Skapa funktionella specifikationer och teknisk dokumentation.
* Utveckla och anpassa Power Apps för att möta specifika affärskrav.
* Automatisera affärsprocesser med hjälp av Power Automate.
* Utbilda och stödja användare under och efter implementeringsfasen.
* Utveckla och implementera Power BI-rapporter och dashboards för att stödja affärsbeslut.
* Samarbeta med tekniska konsulter och utvecklare för att säkerställa enhetliga lösningar.
* Hålla dig uppdaterad om de senaste trenderna och bästa praxis inom Dynamics 365, Power Platform och Power BI.

  


**Minimikvalifikationer:**

  


* Minst 3 års erfarenhet som konsult inom Dynamics 365 Customer Engagement (tidigare CRM).
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av att implementera och konfigurera Dynamics 365- och Power Platform-lösningar.
* Stark förståelse för affärsprocesser inom kundhantering, försäljning, marknadsföring och service.
* Praktisk erfarenhet av Power Apps-utveckling och Power Automate för affärsprocessautomation.
* Förmåga att arbeta självständigt samt i team och hantera flera projekt samtidigt.
* Utmärkt kommunikations- och presentationsförmåga.
* God kunskap i tal och skrift inom svenska och engelska.

  


**Meriterande** **Kvalifikationer:**

  


* Relevant certifiering inom Dynamics 365, Power Platform och/eller Power BI är meriterande.
* Gedigen erfarenhet av Power BI, inklusive utveckling av komplexa rapporter och dashboards.

  


**Kom och jobba med oss på Nemely: Där arbete blir mer än bara ett jobb!**

  



På Nemely erbjuder vi inte bara ett jobb; vi skapar möjligheter till tillväxt, påverkan och personlig utveckling. Här är vad du kan förvänta dig när du blir en del av vårt team:

  


**Vad vi erbjuder:**

  


* **En stimulerande arbetsmiljö:** Dyk in i en dynamisk atmosfär där innovation frodas och dina idéer spelar roll. Varje dag är en möjlighet att hjälpa andra och förbättra dina färdigheter under processen. En spännande och dynamisk arbetsmiljö med möjlighet att arbeta med ledande teknik, inom bl.a. Cloud, AI och mobilitet.

  


* **En välkomnande och inkluderande kultur:** Känn dig uppskattad och respekterad på en mångfaldig och inkluderande arbetsplats som firar individualitet och främjar samarbete.

  


* **Kontinuerligt lärande och utveckling:** Driv din professionella tillväxt framåt med kontinuerlig vidareutbildning, utveckling och möjligheter att erhålla certifieringar som skjuter din karriär framåt.

  


* **Konkurrenskraftig lön och ytterligare förmåner:** Ta fördel av en konkurrenskraftig lön med förmåner som förbättrar din totala upplevelse på Nemely. Vi erbjuder flexibla arbetsformer med möjlighet till distansarbete.

  


**Om Nemely:**

  



Vi är ett konsultbolag som är specialiserat på att leverera CRM-lösningar till företag inom olika branscher. Vårt mål är att hjälpa våra kunder att effektivisera sin verksamhet och öka lönsamheten genom att utnyttja modern teknologi. Vi är ett företag med höga ambitioner som drivs av vårt genuina intresse för teknik och att applicera senaste utvecklingen för att göra verklig nytta inom våra kunders organisationer.

  



Om du är redo att ge dig ut på en givande karriärresa med Nemely, ta tillfället i akt och skicka in din ansökan med ett CV och personligt brev redan idag! Upptäck mer om våra förmåner och vad som skiljer oss från mängden på vår hemsida på nemely.com/careers/our-benefits

  



Ditt nästa karriärsteg väntar. Börja hos Nemely och låt oss uppnå storhet tillsammans!

title: Konsultuppdrag | Project Manager for the Airplus integration
description:
**Profile/Role: Project Manager for the Airplus integration**  

  

**Expected years of experience: 4+ years**  

**Utilization: 100%**  

**Start:** 01-nov-2024 - 30-jun-2026  

**Location/remote availability: Sthlm office 3 days per week**  

  

**Role/Assignment Overview:**  

  

  

**AirPlus Processing is moving card scheme processing from an external party to an in-house solution for card processing.**  

  

**The project is challenging and will require close collaboration between Teams at AirPlus (Germany) and Cards (Stockholm). The majority of development in Stockholm - teams are highly motivated and skilled - Cards have been doing processing on a large scale for many years and has managed to keep a high level of competence.**  

  

**The ideal candidate has experience in high volume, high availability transaction processing. The Project will be connecting to back-end infrastructures - (Mainframe Stockholm) and cloud-based (primarily based on microservices in .Java & KAFKA).**  

**Development are carried out by our agile teams - and interfacing with the agile methodology in a SaFE environment will be needed. Ring-fenced teams will not be available but the project will have priority 1 for affected teams (after regulatory & daily operations).**  

  

**Excellent people & communication skills are needed since the process involves getting two organisations to collaborate.**  

**The focus will be on getting the job done, removing impediments not on reporting since a close collaboration will take place with Program management.**  

  

  

**Good news - you will work with the best in the industry - Cards has a long history of acquisitions which has been successfully integrated thus keeping Cards very competitive.**

  

**Om oss**

*Senterprise Consulting är ett eget affärsområde inom Senterprise Sverige och är en ledande oberoende förmedlare av frilansande konsulter.*

title: HPC Operations Manager
description:
**Do you possess clear leadership skills and have the ability to coach and develop a technical team? Are you looking for your next challenge in a company with a strong focus on sustainability and experiencing significant growth?**


As an HPC Operations Manager, you will be responsible for managing and optimizing the operation of our high-performance computing (HPC) systems. You will oversee the architecture and ensure that the solution is built and developed in close collaboration with your team. The role involves planning and executing maintenance, updates, and troubleshooting to ensure the system operates smoothly for customers needing powerful computational capacity for advanced analyses and simulations. You and your team will monitor system performance, manage resource allocation, and ensure both software and hardware are functioning optimally — tasks that you actively support, develop, and plan for. When needed, you will also work hands-on with solutions.


As HPC Operations Manager, you will collaborate with various teams to ensure that the system meets business needs. You will be responsible for leading, developing, and supporting your team, which consists of HPC specialists spread across Gothenburg, Iceland, and Spain. The primary responsibility is to create cohesion within the team, structure the work, and drive development forward. You will work with a solution that operates around the clock, requiring a strong customer focus. The responsibility for HPC spans several countries, primarily Sweden and Iceland, but eventually extending to Denmark and Finland.

**Your main responsibilities within the team include:**

* Hiring manager and personnel responsibility (currently 4 people, with more to come) – You will be responsible for recruitment, work environment, and conducting employee reviews, ensuring the team’s development and well-being.
* Leading installation and configuration - You will be responsible for leading the team through the installation and configuration of HPC systems, including network and storage.
* Guiding in troubleshooting - You will guide the team in quickly identifying and solving performance and technical issues.
* Resource management and optimization - You will oversee and lead the optimization of system resources and applications to maximize efficiency.
* Maintenance and security - You will ensure that the team carries out regular updates and implements security solutions to protect the system.
* Team and project management - You will inspire and coach the team while driving projects toward successful delivery.


The role involves extensive communication and collaboration. As HPC Operations Manager, you will work closely with the Chief HPC Officer, Support & Applications, Development, and Customer Delivery to ensure that projects and solutions are delivered and developed over time. In this role, you will report to the Chief HPC Officer. We offer a hybrid working arrangement, but since part of our team is based in Gothenburg, we prefer that the applicant resides in or around Gothenburg.

**Is this you?**


To succeed in this role, it is essential to have solid knowledge of Linux system administration and good skills in configuration management. Ideally, you have an academic background in computer science, informatics, or a related field from a technical university. You have at least 5 years of experience as a technical hiring manager and/or 10 years of experience leading technical teams. Additionally, a strong understanding of cloud solutions, expertise in virtualization systems, network management, and storage design across different types is valued. Fluent English, both spoken and written, is a requirement, and knowledge of Swedish is considered a merit.


We value not only your technical skills but also your leadership abilities and personal qualities. We are looking for someone who is a supportive and clear leader, capable of creating a positive and inclusive work environment. You are motivated by seeing your team develop and enjoy supporting them as they face challenges. Your strength lies in generously sharing your knowledge and experience while actively fostering a culture of collaboration and continuous learning within the team.

**Want to know more?**


In this recruitment, atNorth is collaborating with Level Recruitment. To apply for the position, click on the "apply" button. For questions, please contact recruitment consultant Stina Koskijev at +46 8-120 50 421 or stina.koskijev@levelrecruitment.se. Please note that applications are not accepted via email. Kindly apply with a CV clearly describing the aspects of the role where you have previous experience.


The selection of applications will be ongoing.

title: Directory Services Architect
description:
**Epical is a pure-play data consultancy with services and** **expertise to support and enable the management, utilization and protection of our clients' data. We're not just experts in data; we're trust-makers who empower our clients to exceed expectations. Join us in our mission to empower organizations through secure and efficient digital identity management, while fostering a culture of empathy, accountability, and curiosity.**

  

**What is this role all about?**


We are seeking a highly skilled **Directory Services Architect** to join our Digital Trust team. As a Directory Services Architect, you will have overall responsibility for implementing identity solutions and directories such as Active Directory, federation, authentication, and authorization for identities and devices. To succeed in the role, you have prior experience in implementing the above technologies and concepts in larger, complex environments with high-security requirements and a solid understanding of Public Key Infrastructure (PKI) in the context of these technologies and products.


**Key** **r****esponsibilities:**

* Creating designs for technical implementations, in regard to the customers’ requirements and demands
* Manage the deliveries of both architectural and technical solutions and that solution proposals can be implemented in practice
* Be aware and kept up to date with common vulnerabilities and threats within the identity domain and be able to mitigate them both in design choices and in the implementation of technical solutions
* Collaborate on team-level but still being comfortable taking own initiatives to drive your own work and projects forward
* Stay updated on industry trends and best practices within Directory Services and the identity domain
* Ensure security standards and regulatory requirements are being considered in customer deliveries

  

The role is a full-time position, and you can live anywhere in Sweden or in Finland as we apply remote work culture, depending on customer assignments. We do have 10 centrally located offices in different cities across Sweden and Finland.  

  



  

**Are you our next trust-maker?**


To succeed in this role, you should have...


* At least 10 years of technical expertise in Active Directory Domain Services (AD DS) at an expert level – implementation, design, and securing.
* At least 3 years of experience in designing and implementing the Microsoft Legacy Tier Model or Enterprise Access Model with Privilege Access Workstations (PAWs).
* A minimum of 5 completed projects related to Active Directory Domain Services (AD DS).
* At least 3 completed projects related to Active Directory Domain Services (AD DS) and security where a tier model has been implemented – the most recent not older than 2018.
* At least 3 years of experience with Public Key Infrastructure (PKI) in relation to Active Directory Domain Services (AD DS) – as well as Smart Card or Yubikey authentication.
* At least 3 years of technical expertise and understanding of DNS.
* Excellent knowledge of Windows Server and Windows Client, Group Policy, and advanced troubleshooting.
* Good knowledge of authentication/authorization protocols such as NTLM, Kerberos, SAML, OAuth2, and OIDC.
* Good knowledge of network segmentation and IPSec in Windows Firewall (Domain and Server Isolation) and 802.1x.

Fluent in English, speaking and writing  

* 

  

**Strongly** **merited skills**

* Previous experience in the design, implementation, and troubleshooting of Active Directory Certificate Services (AD CS).
* Previous experience in the design, implementation, and troubleshooting of Active Directory Federation Services (AD FS).
* Previous experience with VMware Cloud Foundation (VCF) in relation to authentication and authorization (ESXi, vCenter, vIDM, NSX-T Manager).
* Knowledge of PowerShell and .NET Framework for automating identity and Active Directory-related tasks (System.Directory Services.).
* Previous experience with Thales Luna HSM and/or Thales CipherTrust Manager.
* Previous experience with SecMaker/PointSharp’s NetID Portal.
* Previous experience with Microsoft Entra ID
* Previous experience with Identity and Access Management (IAM) solutions.
* Previous experience designing solutions for Operational Technology (OT) environments.
* At least 1 year of experience within project(s) involving security-sensitive operations.

Fluency in Swedish or Finnish in both speaking and writing  

* 

  

As a Directory Services Architect, we expect you to have great analytical skills, pay attention to detail, and possess strong communication and collaboration skills. You are curious, commit to continuous development and learning as well as you are adaptable to change.  

  



  

**What do** **we offer?**

* A chance to join a team of the Nordic region’s leading experts in Digital Trust, where curiosity is encouraged, and sharing knowledge is a priority.
* Engaging and challenging hands-on assignments, collaborating with large global clients in complex environments.
* A supportive organization that values accountability, while also promoting work-life balance and offering the flexibility to work remotely.
* A comprehensive compensation and benefits package.

Ongoing opportunities for education and growth. Access to Visual Studio Enterprise Subscription and Azure/O365 lab environment, courses and certifications to fuel your curiosity and professional development.  

* 

  

**Let’s secure the Nordic’s together, one step at a time**


We cannot wait to see your application today! Selection will take place on an ongoing basis.


**To qualify for this role, you need to live and have a residence, as well as a citizenship/work permit in Sweden or Finland.** If you have any questions regarding the role, please do not hesitate to contact me. I can be reached at malla.soderberg@epicalgroup.com.


***Our expertise is data. Our product is trust.***

We’re epical.


And you’re welcome to join us.

title: Solutions Architect
job_function: Engineering, Business Development, and Information Technology
company_industry: Software Development, IT System Custom Software Development, and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
**Role:** 
 Solutions Architect
 



**Location:** 
 Stockholm, flexible/hybrid
 



  





 As a Software Solutions Architect, you will lead the design and architecture of software solutions across our organization. This role requires a blend of deep technical expertise and a comprehensive understanding of architectural principles, ensuring our software is robust, scalable, and aligned with business goals.
 



  





 You will play a vital role in translating complex business challenges into innovative technical solutions by creating forward-thinking architectures that address both current and future needs.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 




 - Architectural Design: Develop and implement comprehensive architectural solutions for complex business systems, ensuring alignment with business requirements and performance targets.
 



 - Technical Leadership: Provide guidance and leadership to development teams, overseeing processes to ensure best practices in coding and design are followed.
 



 - Hands-on Development: Engage in coding, reviewing, and testing critical components requiring advanced programming skills. Use programming expertise to prototype new ideas and concepts.
 



 - Systems Integration: Design and manage the integration of new applications with existing systems, ensuring seamless communication between diverse systems and components.
 



 - Risk Assessment: Identify technical risks and develop mitigation strategies, ensuring the stability, security, and scalability of system architectures.
 



 - Documentation: Create and maintain up-to-date architectural documentation and design records, ensuring accessibility for all relevant parties.
 



  





**Required Skills and Qualifications:** 




 - 8+ years of experience in software development and architecture.
 



 - Proficient programming skills in C#.
 



 - Experience with both monolithic and microservices architectures.
 



 - Proven ability to design scalable and efficient software systems.
 



 - Familiarity with cloud platforms and cloud-native solutions.
 



 - Strong knowledge of database design and best practices.
 



 - Excellent problem-solving and analytical abilities.
 



 - Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
 



  





**Desired Attributes:** 




 - Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field; a Master’s degree is preferred.
 



 - An innovative thinker with a passion for technology and problem-solving.
 



 - A collaborative team player who thrives in a dynamic environment.
 



 - Strong project management skills with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.
 



  





 Sound interesting or would like to learn more about the role? Please feel free to get in touch or apply with your CV in English

title: Information Technology Support Specialist
description:
*Untd Rtl är ett bolag inom Jotunfjell Partners-koncernen. Untd Rtl stöttar och servar koncernens övriga bolag med affärsutveckling, tillväxt och administrativa uppdrag inom retail och bolagsstyrning. Untd Rtl erbjuder tjänster inom bland annat Ekonomi, HR och IT. I koncernen ingår modeföretagen Brothers, Johnells, Best of Brands m fl.* 




  





**Kavlitetsmedveten teknisk Systemförvaltare** 




  





 Vi är på en spännande resa, vill du hänga på? Vi söker dig som vill vara med och utveckla e-handeln i våra systerbolag, i rollen som Teknisk Systemägare. Tjänsten innebär att du kommer arbeta med utveckling och förvaltning av den tekniska e-handelsplattformen, CRM-verktyg och systemintegrationer. Målet med rollen är att säkra en sömlös och effektiv e-handelsdrift.
 



  





 Dina arbetsuppgifter i urval:
 


* Utveckling och förvaltning av e-handelsplattformen Adobe Commerce Cloud/Magento så att plattformen kontinuerligt möter marknadskrav och affärsbehov.
* Teknisk utveckling av CRM-verktyget Voyado i syfte att skapa och underhålla starka kundrelationer.
* Hantera och förbättra integrationer mellan olika system för att säkerställa effektiva dataflöden och processer.
* Lösa tekniska utmaningar och optimera integrationerna.
* Implementera och optimera Omni Channel-funktionalitet med målsättningen att skapa en enhetlig och sömlös köpupplevelse i både fysiska butiker och e-handel.



  





 Du kommer ingå i IT-teamet men har också nära samarbete med kollegerna, framför allt inom e-handel och försäljning.
 



  





 Vi söker dig som har jobbat några år i en liknande roll och nu vill ha utveckling i karriären. För att ha framgång i rollen behöver du vara kommunikativ och lösningsorienterad. Att arbeta inom retail är föränderligt vilket ständigt präglar vår vardag. Det gör att du behöver vara pragmatisk, framåtsträvande och ha lätt för att ställa om när förutsättningarna förändras.
 



  





 Vi hoppas du har:
 


* Erfarenhet av förvaltning av digitala plattformar.
* Erfarenhet av Adobe Commerce Cloud (Magento 2) eller likvärdig e-handelsplattform.
* Erfarenhet av Voyado.
* Erfarenhet av att hantera och optimera systemintegrationer (API, Cloud connector).
* Förmåga att förstå och översätta affärsbehov till tekniska krav och lösningar.
* Teknisk bakgrund inom webbutveckling är meriterande.
* Erfarenhet av projektledning är meriterande.



  





 Tillsvidareanställning med 6 månaders provanställning. Heltid.
 



 Kontoret ligger centralt på Kungsholms Strand.
 



  





 Skicka din ansökan med personligt brev till jobs@untd-rtl.com
 



 Vänta inte med att söka, vi kommer tillsätta tjänsten då vi har hittat varandra.
 



  





 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Head of Enterprise Greenfield, Europe North, AWS
description:
**Description**
 The Head of Enterprise Greenfield is a senior leadership team position in AWS Europe North, which is responsible for leading a multi-layer sales organization focused on driving new customer acquisition, platform adoption and revenue growth from net new enterprise customers which include some of the most recognizeable name brands in the world across the 11 countries of the Nordics, Benelux and Baltics. They lead a distributed team of senior enterprise sales managers and sales reps, and partner closely across Marketing, Inside Sales, Partner, Professional Services, Training & Certification and Enterprise Support to deliver a high-quality customer experience and support our customers in their journey to the cloud.
   

  

 This role requires a seasoned sales professional and self-starter who will own, develop and execute the Enterprise Greenfield strategy in Europe North, drive effective engagement with customer CXO and SVP level business and technical executives, and achieve scale through partner, marketing and the Inside Sales Centre function. As a 2nd line manager role, this leader must be adept at both hiring and developing managers, as well as sales reps, and at scaling through their team. The right candidate brings deep and strong C-level relationships and experience (business and IT/CIO functions) with strong business acumen and executive presence that enables them to convince customer executives that AWS is the right strategic partner to help them achieve their business objectives. The role reports directly to the Europe North Leader.
   

  

 Successful candidates will have a demonstrated ability to think strategically and analytically about business, product, and technical challenges, with the ability to build and convey compelling value propositions while working cross-organizationally to build consensus. They will have high standards in managing a sales pipeline, and possess strong communication skills such as discovery/active listening skills and empathy, as well as demonstrated ability to provide constructive mentoring in these areas.
   

  

 Key job responsibilities
   

  

* Develop the short, medium, and long-term Europe North Enterprise Greenfield strategy including critical scaling mechanisms like marketing, sales plays and campaigns, executive engagement, skills and enablement.
* Define a comprehensive Enterprise Greenfield partner strategy to scale and grow Enterprise Greenfield through the partner ecosystem including global and national system integrators, consulting and technology partners.
* Manage sales cadence through robust performance measures and reviews, using data driven analytics, to drive strong sales execution. This includes owning all metrics and goals and reporting of all account related activity i.e. sales forecasting, account strategy, demand generation, deal strategy development and trend analysis.
* Lead establishing and nurturing external communities, and driving large events. Defining which of these we do (CIO Forums, CXO Advisory Groups, etc.), and working with local and regional leaders to implement globally.
* Hire, develop and retain a strong team of sales professionals who are responsible for building net new business in Europe North.


 A day in the life
   

  

 Diverse Experiences
   

  

 Amazon values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
   

  

 Why AWS
   

  

 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance
   

  

 We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why flexible work hours and arrangements are part of our culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.
   

  

 Inclusive Team Culture
   

  

 Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.
   

  

 Mentorship and Career Growth
   

  

 We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
* Various years of technology related sales or business development experience.
* Strong Sales management experience leading teams selling enterprise solutions for software, hardware or IT
* Strong experience developing CEO level relationships across large enterprises and demonstrated ‘door opening’ capability
* Experience as a Leader of Leaders with team focus of development of large strategic accounts
* BA/BS degree required.


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Strong verbal and written communications skills
* A technical background in engineering, computer science, or MIS a plus.
* Commercial and contract negotiation experience
* Ability “to sell business value” using ROI and TCO models, rather than competing on “features & functions”


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
   

  

  

**Company** 
 - AWS EMEA SARL (Sweden Branch)
   

  

 Job ID: A2751447

 Germany

 The Chief Technology Officer (CTO) will play a pivotal role in shaping technology vision, driving product innovation, and scaling our business to new heights. * Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to articulate complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.

 Hybrid (2 days in the office weekly)
 



**Salary:** 
 Starting at 50,000 SEK/month (negotiable based on experience)
 



**Language Requirement:** 
 Fluency in Swedish
 



  





**Overview:** 




 We are looking for an experienced
 **Test Lead** 
 to join our client’s IT team in
 **Stockholm** 
 . This is a fantastic opportunity to be part of a large-scale transformation project, working with an outdated IT system that’s ready for a full revamp. The website, built in 2003, along with multiple system layers, will be modernized to meet current business demands. You’ll play a crucial role in ensuring the quality and functionality of these systems throughout the project.
 



  





**Responsibilities:** 



* Lead the testing strategy and execution for a highly complex IT environment.
* Design and implement
 **test automation** 
 frameworks and manage automated test cases.
* Create and perform
 **complex test cases** 
 for multi-layered systems with various communicating components.
* Collaborate with a small but dedicated IT team (30 members, including developers and architects) to ensure seamless system integration and functionality.
* Be hands-on with a
 **Microsoft/Azure-based strategy** 
 , working with
 **.NET on a MAC architecture** 
 .



  





**Key Qualifications:** 



* Proven experience as a Test Lead or in a similar role, with a strong focus on
 **test automation** 
 .
* Ability to design, develop, and execute
 **complex test cases** 
 for multi-layered systems.
* Solid understanding of IT systems with multiple communicating layers.
* Familiarity with
 **Microsoft/Azure environments** 
 and
 **.NET-based systems** 
 .
* Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
* Fluency in
 **Swedish** 
 is essential.



  





**Why Join?** 
 This is a
 **huge undertaking** 
 , and you’ll have the opportunity to be part of a transformational project from the ground up. Our client has already begun work on updating their systems, and you’ll be a key player in driving quality assurance, ensuring that the new systems are efficient, reliable, and meet modern standards.
 



  





 If you are passionate about tackling complex challenges and want to contribute to a significant IT transformation, we’d love to hear from you!

title: Senior Network Engineer
description:
We are Sinch. Join us and be a part of a global leader in Communication Platforms as a Service (CPaaS) and mobile customer engagement. With presence in more than 60 countries, we enable businesses to reach everyone in the world, through mobile messaging, email, voice, and video.
   

  

 We believe equal opportunities are the key to our success. No matter who you are, you'll be able to explore career options, face captivating challenges, and build skills alongside outstanding people.
   

  

**The essence of the role**
 We're seeking an experienced Senior Network Engineer to join our Public Cloud Integration team and play a key role in shaping Sinch's network infrastructure. You will have the opportunity to lead and enhance our network across co-location data centers, AWS, and other cloud service providers. If you possess deep technical expertise in Network Architecture, managing global bandwidth, particularly in Cisco iOS, ASA, routing protocols, IPSec, MPLS, and hybrid infrastructure integration, we look forward to hearing from you.
   

  

 This role is based in Stockholm, Sweden, and functions under a hybrid model, reporting to the Head of Cloud Network.
   

  

**As Our New Network Engineer, You Will**
* Coordinate, maintain, and architect all network and security devices.
* Proactively monitor systems for performance issues and participate in capacity planning, analysis, and system implementations.
* Lead troubleshooting efforts with internal teams and external partners to ensure system stability.
* Build and maintain documentation for data centers, systems, applications, and networks.
* Collaborate with global team members to safeguard the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of Sinch network and services.
* Perform site inventories and installations at various local and remote data center locations as needed.
* Contribute to rotational on-call duties.


**Who are you?**
 We believe you're experienced with network performance monitoring, enterprise-level data center design, and Linux/Unix networking. Your knowledge of cloud infrastructure, knack for delivering results, impressive multitasking abilities, and strong communication skills stand out. You perform well under pressure and excel in managing project details.
   

  

 To contribute to this role, we see that you have experience in:
   

  

* Switching (spanning tree, Ether-Channel, 802.1q VLANs).
* Routing expertise (BGP, OSPF, EIGRP).
* Packet capture and analysis.
* Implementing IP layer access control and configuring IOS and ASA based IPSEC VPNs.
* Upgrading IOS, ASA, and associated software.
* Networking in AWS and understanding cloud environments.
* Change Management and ITIL processes.
* Additional System Administrator knowledge at the infrastructure level is beneficial.


**Ready to chase your dreams?**
 If you're passionate about ensuring network reliability, optimizing performance, and collaborating with a distributed team, this role is for you!
   

  

 Our corporate language is English. Please submit your application in English.
   

  

 At Sinch, we value learning, adopt change, and offer opportunities for personal and professional growth. Unfortunately, we are not able to support relocation outside EU at present, therefore, will take into consideration only applicants who hold a Swedish or EU/EEA citizenship, or have a valid work permit for Sweden.

title: Business Intelligence Engineer
description:
**Business Intelligence Consultant - Specialised in cloud based platforms** 




  





 Nigel Frank are partnered with a leading BI consultancy who continuously keep an eye on the market for skilled consultants who are interested in delivering an entire data project to their customer, not just working on a small section.
 



  





 They were founded by highly experienced consultants (each with 20+ years of experience) who felt as though the larger consultancies they worked with, didn't deliver what the customer actually needed; a tailored and thorough data delivery.
 



  





 Their consultants work with the customer to thoroughly understand their need, consulting on what would be the best route and then build and deliver that with a team of highly-skilled consultants. They will then continue to work with these companies to ensure the platforms are being used to their highest potential and often these projects can take up to two years.
 



  





 If you're somebody who's either feeling the same as their founders and want to explore a more consultative environment, or you want to step into a consulting role as you feel ready to work with interesting projects that will challenge you to progress in your career, this could be a great option for you.
 



  






 What can you look forward to?
 



* Hybrid policy with an encouraged 2-3 days in their Stockholm office
* Your choice of laptop and set-up
* With over 30 customers who consistently work with them they have interesting projects in various industries Logistics, Transport, Manufacturing, Automotive and Retail
* Competitive remuneration package: high base salaries, collective bonus, you specify your pension level and over 30 days' vacation
* Monthly catch-ups with your manager to make sure you’re happy with your work and on the right path to reach your goals
* A fantastic team and culture which is friendly and supportive
* Highly senior team that supports knowledge sharing and progression
* Time and budget devoted to training and development
* Team trips abroad and in Sweden throughout the year



  





 Their technology stack includes Azure BI and Data stack inc. Data Factory, Databricks, Synapse, etc., GCP, AWS, Power BI and some Tableau. They are now also working with customer that are encouraging more Data Science methods.
 



  





 If you want to develop within the most prominent data platforms and join a team of colleagues who encourage knowledge sharing and progression, take a look at the requirements below.
 



  






 What we need from you
 



* At least 2 years of BI or data engineering experience: building data pipelines, modelling, cleansing, transformation, data warehousing, etc.
* Proficiency in a cloud platform: Azure, GCP or AWS
* Skilled in working with databases, both on prem and cloud: Snowflake, SQL, Postgres, etc.
* A desire to learn more and keep on up-skilling – current consultants are building their experience in advanced analytics (AI/ML) and project leadership
* Strong communication demonstrated through managing and engaging stakeholders and eliciting requirements effectively
* Analytical and problem-solving skills
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team – you will be working alongside your skilled colleagues while also taking the initiative
* Experience with visualisation and tools such as Power BI, Qlik, Tableau, etc.
* Fluency in Swedish is required



  





 This is an established company that has a fantastic reputation and since they prioritise having a great culture and working environment, you can expect to be surrounded by the latest tech and very best consultants; offering you a great chance to continue to grow your skill set.
 



  





 As a consultant, no two days will be the same, really giving you an opportunity to propel your career forward.
 



  





 If you find this opportunity interesting, apply and we can run through the details. Alternatively, if you have any questions, drop me a message on LinkedIn or give me a call: +46 77 588 86 15

title: Sales Development Specialist
Technical Business Analyst - SAS/EAP/Azure/Databricks - Long Term Contract
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting and Financial Services
description:
**Technical Business Analyst - SAS/EAP/Azure/Databricks - Long Term Contract**




  





 We are looking for a talented and passionate Technical Business Analyst to play a key role in our customers exciting data transformation project to migrate from SAS to EAP (Azure Databricks). This is a unique opportunity to dive deep into the world of data, work with cutting-edge technologies, and make a real impact on how we harness the power of analytics.
 



  





 In this role, you will be the bridge between the technical teams and the business side, helping to ensure a seamless transition of banking data from SAS to the Enterprise Analytics Platform (EAP). Your expertise will be essential in discovering, understanding, and preparing data for this critical migration, ensuring it aligns perfectly with our evolving business needs.
 



  





 You will work closely with various teams, from developers to stakeholders, guiding the project as we unlock the potential of EAP to deliver faster, more powerful insights. Your contributions will help shape the future of data analytics for the bank, giving you a sense of ownership and accomplishment as we complete this journey together.
 



  





 This is a full-time, freelance position offering long-term prosperity with the transformation due to last a number of years.
 



  





**This is an urgent role with interview slots confirmed with the client, so please apply immediately if this sounds like the next role for you!**

title: Cloud Security Architect
description:
*Zelly är ett ledande ”born-in-the-cloud” företag . Vi utvecklar och optimerar molntjänster från Microsoft och ser till att våra kunder har tillgång till de bäst lämpade molntjänsterna för deras verksamhet.*
 Är du redo att ta Zelly´s säkerhetsarbete till nya höjder?
   

  

 Vi har stora ambitioner när det kommer till vårt IT-säkerhetsarbete och vill därmed utöka vårt team med en Cloud Security Architect. Zelly är ett dynamiskt och snabbväxande Cloud-bolag som levererar alla Microsofts cloudplattformar. Vi tror på en Cloud first-approach och ser styrkan i att utnyttja synergier i Microsofts ekosystem. Zelly är den perfekta arbetsplatsen för dig som vill utvecklas, gillar att ta ansvar och kunna ha möjligheten att påverka din arbetsplats. Vi ser gärna att du är hungrig på ny teknologi, vill hjälpa kunderna till en bättre, enklare och säkrare vardag.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Som Cloud Security Architect kommer du vara en viktig del i våra nya och befintliga kunders säkerhetsstrategi. Du är ansvarig för att proaktivt leda, motivera och utmana kunder i projekt och hjälpa dem att säkra verksamhet och användare. Vardagen kommer innebära mycket kontakt med kunder och arbetet varierar mellan allt ifrån pre-sale, arkitektur, specificera anpassningar och integrationer, till att hålla i workshops och utbilda kunderna. Du kommer jobba både självständigt och i team där din åsikt och erfarenhet kommer att vara betydelsefull, samtidigt som det finns kollegor att bolla med. Du kommer få vara med och driva hur arbetssätt och tjänster inom säkerhetsområdet ska utvecklas. Vi erbjuder en heltidstjänst som utgår från vårt trevliga kontor vid Gullmarsplan, högst upp i Sthlm New 01-byggnaden, med fantastisk utsikt över Stockholm!
   

  

**Vi söker dig som har:**
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av Active Directory, Entra ID, Microsoft 365, Microsoft Sentinel, Microsoft Defender XDR och Microsoft Purview
* Djupgående teknisk kunskap inom Microsofts olika säkerhetstekniker som används för att skydda identiteter, enheter och information samt för att upptäcka riskfyllda beteenden och hot
* Erfarenhet av Azure eller motsvarande cloudplattform och förståelse för säkerhetsprinciper för molnbaserade tjänster.
* Erfarenhet av att verka som rådgivare och tekniskt stöd till kund
* Erfarenhet av att fånga krav och omsätta i lösning
* Talar och skriver obehindrat på svenska och engelska


**Vem är du?**
 För att trivas hos oss tror vi att du är nyfiken på olika verksamhetsprocesser och kunders behov, intresserad av Microsoft cloud och dess utveckling, trivs med frihet under ansvar, är en lagspelare och gillar att utveckla rutiner och processer.
   

  

**Dina möjligheter hos oss:**
* Bra villkor och stora utvecklingsmöjligheter i ett snabbt expanderande IT-bolag!
* Möjlighet till delägarskap i Aderian Group som är koncernen som Zelly ingår i
* Då vårt mål är att du ska bli bäst på molntjänster betalar vi gärna för din fortbildning. För när du utvecklas – utvecklas vi!
* Självklart erbjuder vi både förmåner och bonusar
* Roliga resor och aktiviteter tillsammans!


 Rekrytering sker löpande – där tillträde och lön sker enligt överenskommelse. Vi kommer genomföra bakgrundkontoroll som en del av rekryteringsprocessen.
   

  

 Känns detta som en tjänst för dig? Skicka in din ansökan redan idag så kontaktar vi dig så snart som möjligt.
   

  

 Hoppas att vi hörs!

title: IT-specialist med erfarenhet av Nutanix
description:
Vi söker en erfaren IT-specialist som kan hjälpa oss att utveckla och underhålla våra kunders IT-infrastruktur, med fokus på Nutanix, Har du en stark teknisk bakgrund och erfarenhet av att arbeta med virtualisering, enhetshantering och säkerhet? Då kan du vara den vi söker! 
 



  





**Om rollen:** 
  
 


* Som IT-specialist kommer du att spela en viktig roll i vår IT-avdelning, där du kommer att arbeta med att designa, installera, konfigurera och säkerställa stabil och effektiv drift av bl.a. våra kunders Nutanix-plattformar samt virtualiseringslösningar. Du kommer att arbeta nära vårt team av hjältar för att optimera system, implementera och administrera Nutanix-lösningar, inklusive virtualisering och hyperkonvergerad infrastruktur.
* Säkerställa att IT-infrastrukturen är säker och fungerar smidigt, både för stationära och mobila enheter.
* Samordna och utföra felsökning, support och underhåll av Nutanix-miljöer
* Arbeta tillsammans med säkerhetsteamet för att följa riktlinjer och säkerhetskrav.
* Deltaga i utvecklingsprojekt för att förbättra och vidareutveckla IT-miljöerna hos våra kunder.



  





**Kvalifikationer:** 
  
 


* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med Nutanix, inklusive installation, konfiguration och administration av virtualiseringslösningar.
* Goda kunskaper inom virtualiseringstekniker så som tex VMWare, HyperV
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med säkerhet
* Stark problemlösningsförmåga och erfarenhet av att hantera IT-support och drift.
* Förmåga att arbeta självständigt men också att vara en del där du samarbetar med vårt team av hjältar.
* Goda språkkunskaper i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.



  
 



**Meriterande:** 
  
 


* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med andra moln- och virtualiseringsplattformar.
* Certifieringar inom Nutanix
* Erfarenhet av automatiseringsverktyg som Powershell.



  





**Varför Infozone?** 
   
 



 Infozone är inte bara en arbetsplats, det är en plats där innovation, samarbete och utveckling står i centrum. Vi erbjuder en kreativ och stimulerande miljö där våra konsulter ständigt utmanas att hitta nya lösningar och utvecklas i sina yrkesroller. Som en del av Infozone får du möjlighet att arbeta med några av de mest erfarna och kompetenta experterna inom virtualisering och systemhantering. Vi ser oss som en stor familj där vi växer tillsammans vilket vi gör med en stark kultur, kunskapsutveckling och ett härligt go – We Create Heroes!  
 



  





**Ansökan:** 
 Är du redo för nästa steg i din karriär inom IT-säkerhet? Skicka in din ansökan till oss idag och bli en del av Infozone-familjen!

title: QA Technical Lead
company_industry: Computer Hardware Manufacturing, Software Development, and Computer Networking Products
description:
Isovalent, now part of Cisco, is the company founded by the creators of Cilium and eBPF. Cisco Isovalent builds open-source software and enterprise solutions solving networking, security, and observability needs for modern cloud-native infrastructure. The flagship technology, Cilium, is the choice of numerous, industry-leading, global organizations.
   

  

 We believe in fostering an inclusive and diverse workplace where every team member feels valued, respected, and empowered. We are committed to building a culture that embraces individuality and collaboration, and we encourage applicants from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives to join us in driving innovation and excellence.
   

  

**About This Role**
 Isovalent at Cisco is seeking a dynamic and experienced QA Lead to oversee the development and execution of test plans and ensure the quality of enterprise releases used by customers.
   

  

**What you will do:**
* Develop, maintain, and execute comprehensive test environments that most effectively represent our customers with the resources available (headcount and budget)
* Receive product releases and deploy them as a customer would
* Provide feedback to engineering like a customer would
* Focus on quality at scale instead of reproducing individual customer issues.
* Lead and mentor a team of QA engineers, fostering a collaborative and inclusive environment.


**Required Skills and Qualifications:**
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field, or equivalent experience.
* Proven experience giving feedback to engineering teams and increasing product quality
* Hands-on experience with Kubernetes and containerization technologies.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work effectively in a diverse team.


**What the role is not about:**
* This role is not a QA persona that receives development builds from engineering for engineers to outsource testing.
* This role is not a testing outsourcing function for complex engineering projects that need to replicate hard to replicate problems


**Why Cisco**
 Secure
   

  

 We're global, we're adaptable, we're diverse, and our security portfolio is as extensive as it is groundbreaking. Have you heard of Threat, Detection & Response, Zero Trust by Duo, Common Services Engineering, or Cloud & Network Security? Those are only a few of our product teams! The only thing we're missing is YOU.
   

  

 Join an enterprise security leader with a start-up culture, committed to driving innovation and giving you the opportunity to make an impact. We #InnovateToWin and we know we're better together, that's why we're dedicated to inclusivity, collaboration, and diversity in everything we do.
   

  

 We're proud to be the Best Small and Mid-Size Enterprises Security Solution Cisco Secure continues to grow and evolve year after year with 100% of Fortune 100 Companies using our products, and we're excited to see the new heights we'll reach with your passion for security, your customer focus, and your desire to change things up!
   

  

 There are so many amazing reasons to join Cisco. Learn more here!

title: IT Security Specialist - Vulnerability Management
description:
Are you passionate about IT Security and want to be a part of shaping the future of a global organization at the forefront of sustainable transport solutions? At Scania, we are expanding our IT Security Operations group and looking for an IT Security Specialist with a focus on Vulnerability Management. If you thrive in a dynamic environment and want to contribute to exciting innovations, this role might be for you.
   

  

 Who We Are
   

  

 Scania is undergoing an exciting transformation, evolving from a traditional truck manufacturer to a leader in sustainable transport solutions, including electric and autonomous vehicles. Our success depends on flexible, efficient, and secure IT solutions. IT is at the core of this transformation, and our IT Security Operations group plays a crucial role in protecting Scania’s assets and reputation from cyber risks.
   

  

 You will be joining a dedicated team that provides first-class IT security services across four core areas: Vulnerability Management, Endpoint Protection, Penetration Testing & IT Forensics, and our Security Operations Center (SOC). We aim to provide robust security solutions for both the industrial and commercial sides of Scania.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 We are looking for someone who is a problem-solver, a team player, and passionate about security. You have the technical expertise to perform vulnerability scanning and analysis but also the communication skills to explain complex issues to diverse stakeholders.
   

  

**Key qualifications:**
* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Security, or related fields (or equivalent experience).
* Proven experience with vulnerability scanning and analysis in large corporate environments.
* Familiarity with web application scanning tools and techniques.
* Proficiency in scripting languages like PowerShell.
* Excellent communication skills in both English and Swedish.


**Skills We’re Looking For**
 We're especially interested in candidates with experience in:
   

  

  

* Attack Surface Management
* Static-/Dynamic Application Security Testing (SAST/DAST)
* Vulnerability management for cloud environments (e.g., AWS, Azure)
* Handling SaaS vulnerabilities and security challenges


**What You’ll Do**
 As a key member of the Vulnerability Management team, you will collaborate with a dynamic group to reinforce and expand our security services. You’ll support the identification and management of vulnerabilities across Scania's systems, working closely with internal teams to mitigate risks.
   

  

**Your responsibilities will include:**
* Performing vulnerability scanning across systems, servers, networks, and applications to identify and investigate potential weaknesses.
* Maintaining and enhancing our scanning environment by managing upgrades and optimizing tools.
* Collaborating with teams across Scania to explain vulnerabilities in clear, non-technical terms and support their resolution efforts.
* Leading efforts to ensure timely patching and follow-up on vulnerabilities.
* Using your scripting and automation skills (PowerShell and others) to streamline scanning and remediation processes.
* Supporting IT security audits and ensuring compliance with industry standards.


 Conducting detailed web application scans, combining manual analysis with automated tools to ensure comprehensive coverage.
   

  

**Why Scania?**
 By joining Scania, you'll be part of a collaborative and innovative environment. We foster diversity and inclusion, encouraging individuals of all genders and backgrounds to apply. At Scania, we believe that diversity strengthens our teams and promotes creative solutions.
   

  

**What we offer:**
* Permanent employment from day one—no trial period.
* Flexible work arrangements: Choose to work from home, our office in Stockholm City, or our headquarters in Södertälje. We value work-life balance, and we meet once or twice a week in Södertälje for collaboration and fika.
* Continuous development: We invest in your growth, offering training and development opportunities.
* Competitive benefits, including annual bonuses, wellness contributions, and more.


**How To Apply**
 If you’re excited to contribute to a future-facing company with a global impact, we’d love to hear from you. To apply, please submit your resume and a cover letter outlining your experience and why you are interested in joining Scania’s IT Security Operations group. A background check might be conducted for this position.
   

  

**For more information**
 Please contact recruiting manager Rolf Nordin rolf.nordin@scania.com

title: Senior Infrastructure Engineer
description:
**About The Role**
 We are seeking a highly capable Senior Infrastructure Engineer to help shape the future of our infrastructure. You will drive improvements across our products and services, ensuring quality, scalability, and reliability. In this role, you'll lead by example—writing and reviewing code, resolving technical challenges, and advancing automation practices. Whether you have deep experience in the field or are a strong engineer ready to take the next step, we're looking for individuals who are passionate about infrastructure, problem-solving, and innovation.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Lead the technical delivery of complex infrastructure projects, from initial planning to implementation.
* Maintain, scale, and enhance our infrastructure to meet evolving demands.
* Drive automation efforts, ensuring our systems are designed for flexibility and growth.
* Facilitate workshops and training to share best practices and upskill team members.
* Mentor and guide team members, fostering a collaborative and high-performing environment.
* Contribute to architectural decisions and long-term technology strategies.
* Prioritize and manage backlogs, ensuring timely and effective project delivery.
* Support the Service Desk and second-line teams with prioritization and incident handling.
* Stay updated on compliance requirements and contribute to maintaining a secure, compliant infrastructure.
* Uphold the company's values, promoting a culture of knowledge sharing and collaboration.
* Ensure adherence to company processes, procedures, and methodologies for consistent project execution.


**Skills And Qualifications**
* Proven experience with Virtualization and OpenStack technologies.
* Expertise in automation and orchestration tools and practices.
* Strong knowledge of large-scale production systems and the latest industry technologies.
* Ability to design and implement infrastructure solutions, with experience in both small and medium-scale systems.
* Solid programming and scripting skills (e.g., Python, Bash, or similar languages).
* Problem-solving experience, ideally with open-source tools and solutions.
* Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to mentor others and foster collaboration.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
* A strategic mindset, with the ability to weigh cost and value in decision-making processes.


 If you have a solid foundation in infrastructure engineering and are excited about working on challenging projects, we encourage you to apply. This is an opportunity to make a significant impact while working in an environment that values growth, innovation, and teamwork.

title: Solutions Engineer (Mandarin/Chinese Speaker)
description:
Autel Energy business is booming in Europe. We are now inviting talented people to join our team and create a
 **green future** 
 together!
 



  





**About Autel Energy** 




  





 Founded in 2004, Autel Intelligent Technology Corp., Ltd. specializes in the R&D, production, sales, and service of automotive intelligent diagnostics, detection and analysis systems, and automotive electronic components. Autel is one of the world's leading suppliers of automotive intelligent diagnostics, testing, and TPMS products and services. In February 2020, Autel was listed on the SSE STAR Market (stock code: 688208).
 



  





 Autel Energy was launched in 2021, dedicated to providing a full range of AC/DC charging station products and solutions for various scenarios. After three years of rapid development, Autel Energy has become a leading solutions provider of EV charging station products in Europe. With excellent quality and high-quality localized service of AC/DC series products, are highly favored by European energy companies, CPOs, and dealers.
 



  





**In Europe, we have:** 




 - Over 120 employees actively engaged in researching and developing electric vehicle charging solutions, aiming to explore sustainable development for people, vehicles, technology, and new energy.
 



 - 7 subsidiary companies located in the United Kingdom, France, Germany, the Netherlands, Italy, Spain, and Sweden, providing local services and support. We work closely with our customers, understand their needs, and provide customized solutions.
 



 - 4 local training centers dedicated to providing professional product technical training for our customers.
 



 - 2 local cooperative warehousing centers to ensure stable product supply.
 



 - 2 local research and development centers committed to continuous product innovation, providing customers with smarter, more efficient charging solutions, and exploring new opportunities in intelligent driving and new energy.
 



  





 Our team not only focuses on technological innovation but also actively participates in social responsibility projects, aiming to reduce environmental impact and promote sustainable development. We firmly believe that through continuous collaboration and innovation, we can make greater contributions to the electric vehicle industry in Europe and globally, driving the entire sector towards a more environmentally friendly and intelligent direction.
 



  





 For further information, please visit us now at https://de.autelenergy.eu/
 



  





**We offer:** 




 - Highly competitive salary and benefits package
 



 - Excellent career development opportunities
 



 - International work environment
 



 - Opportunities to collaborate and learn from top talents in the industry
 



  





**We look forward to candidates who:** 




 - Have a passion for the new energy industry and are enthusiastic about the charging pile industry
 



 - Possess good communication skills and a spirit of teamwork
 



 - Demonstrate a sense of responsibility and proactiveness
 



 - Candidates with relevant work experience are preferred
 



  





**By joining us, you will:** 




 - Participate in the rapid development of the European new energy market
 



 - Contribute to the cause of green environmental protection
 



 - Collaborate with outstanding talents from around the world
 



 - Achieve your career dreams
 



  





**Job Description:** 




  




* Responsible for technical communications, pre-sales support, consulting for customers and suppliers；
* Design and present solutions based on specific customer requirements；
* Coordinate with product team and R&D team to ensure the implementation of customer projects；
* Enhance relationships with customers and service partners；
* Lead solution projects and internal projects (certifications, workshops)；
* Assist with technical improvements of the products；
* Assess risks and adjust mitigation actions, contribute to the optimization of working processes within the team.



  





**What You’ll Need:** 




  




* Bachelor´s degree in Electrical Engineering Automation, Mechatronics, Electronics or equivalent;
* Pre-sales or solution experience ideally in EV, Automotive or Energy sector;
* Knowledge of electrical vehicles or the charging pile industry, familiar with different charging scenarios and OCPP protocol;
* Confident and competent behavior in dealing with people of all hierarchical levels in an international environment;
* Excellent ability of market development, project coordination and good customer service awareness; Strong responsibility, meticulous and rigorous;
* Strong ability to work under pressure, strong communication skills, affinity and sense of responsibility;
* Fluency in Chinese is a must. Fluency in Italian is a plus.



  





 Location: Stockholm, Stockholm County, Sweden
 



 Start date: As soon as possible
 



 Working hours: Full-time
 



  





 Apply now and join Autel Energy to create a green future together!
 



 Contact: Apply directly on LinkedIn or send your resume to recruitment1.eu@autel.com.
 



 Please mention the position that you are applying for in the subject.
 



 Best of luck with your job application!

**我们期待您:**

**加入我们，您将:**
