title: R&D Product Manager
company_industry: Software Development, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Research Services
description:
Dassault Systèmes, "The 3DEXPERIENCE Company," provides businesses and individuals with the virtual worlds needed to design sustainable innovations that harmonize product, nature and life.
   

  

 As part of the
 *ENOVIA R&D* 
 teams, you will report to the
 *Product Portfolio Planning* 
 organization. This organization is in charge of developing solutions to design commercial offerings for highly configurable products.
   

  

 You will be responsible for the development of a new domain 'CPQ – Configure Price Quote' which will aim to enable our customers to design web and interactive 3D experiences for the creation of configurable and parametric product quotes. These solutions will also automate the creation of the product corresponding to these specifications, which is key for the ETO (Engineering to Order) and CTO (Configured to Order) processes.
   

  

 The solutions will need to integrate with existing 3DEXPERIENCE Platform solutions and the customer engagement, sales, and ordering ecosystem (changed word order)
   

  

 Responsibilities:
   

  

* Define the product strategy within the 3DEXPERIENCE Platform as well as the value of the solution
* Formalize business use cases and their specificities
* Establish the overall architecture of the solution which will be Cloud/Web
* Write all the functional specifications to be covered
* Establish the development plan in line with the corporate guidelines in coordination with the R&D organizations of SOLIDWORKS, CATIA and 3DEXCITE
* Manage the activity of the teams (in France and India) in charge of developments
* Ensure the quality of applications delivered in accordance with company standards
* Mentor and manage multiple teams of developers


 Qualifications:
   

  

* With a higher education Bac+5, Engineering or University, you have significant professional experience acquired in the field of commercial configuration and quote management solutions.
* You have concrete experience in team management
* WEB Application Development (HTML/JavaScript/CSS)
* Development and deployment of SaaS applications and services
* You demonstrate good autonomy and rigor and you know how to synthesize
* You like to work in a multidisciplinary team and are a good listener and interpersonal
* Knowledge of existing market-leading solutions is a plus
* Knowledge of Dassault Systèmes' solutions of the NETVIBES, ENOVIA, CATIA, SOLIDWORKS brands would be a plus
* Your English is fluent in writing and speaking


 What’s in it for you:
   

  

* Multicultural environment
* Friendly working environment focused on well-being and health
* Commitment to diversity and inclusion
* Dynamic career development policy: training plan, internal mobility, etc.
* Integrating a scientific company at the heart of technological innovation, driven by strong growth for more than 40 years


**Diversity statement**
 As a game-changer in sustainable technology and innovation, Dassault Systèmes is striving to build more inclusive and diverse teams across the globe. We believe that our people are our number one asset and we want all employees to feel empowered to bring their whole selves to work every day. It is our goal that our people feel a sense of pride and a passion for belonging. As a company leading change, it’s our responsibility to foster opportunities for all people to participate in a harmonized Workforce of the Future.

title: Analytics Engineer
description:
Avalanche Studios Group (ASG) is looking for an experienced Analytics Engineer to join our data team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for creating, designing and maintaining our data architecture. This role requires a deep understanding of data engineering, data modeling, data visualization, event design and best practices in those areas.
   

  

 This is a key role in developing our data lake by bridging the gap between our data engineer and our data scientists as well as ensuring that our data is timely, easy to work with and trusted across the company.
   

  

**What You'll Do**
**Clean and transform data for analytical use:**
* Develop and implement processes to extract, clean, and transform data from various sources to ensure it is ready for analysis.
* Collaborate with data scientists and analysts to understand their data needs and provide them with reliable datasets.
* Design and implement data models and aggregated history tables for all major KPI’s and user history.
* Design and implement data models that support business needs and analytics requirements.


**Maintain Data Documentation And Definitions**
* Create and maintain comprehensive data documentation, including data dictionaries, schemas, and metadata.
* Ensure that data definitions are consistent and easily accessible to all stakeholders.
* Ensure data quality, integrity, and availability:
* Implement automated data quality checks and validation processes to ensure the accuracy and reliability of data.
* Monitor data pipelines and systems to ensure high availability and performance alongside our data engineer.
* Help the game teams and analysts in designing the events that our games log as well as their associated triggers


**Share Best Practices Across The Organization**
* Promote a culture of data excellence by sharing best practices and providing training.
* Stay updated with the latest trends and technologies in data engineering and analytics and share knowledge with the team.
* Write efficient, maintainable, and scalable analytics code using best practices.
* Conduct code and SQL reviews and provide feedback to ensure high standards of code quality within the team.


**Who You Are**
* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Data Engineering, or a related field.
* Proven experience as an Analytics Engineer, Data Architect, or similar role.
* Strong proficiency in SQL and experience with data modeling tools and techniques.
* Experience with ETL processes and tools (e.g., Apache Airflow, Talend, DBT etc.).
* Familiarity with cloud-based data platforms (e.g., AWS, GCP, Azure). GCP is a big plus.
* Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
* Strong communication skills and the ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams.
* Passion for gaming and a deep understanding of the gaming industry is a plus.


**The Stockholm location**
 Our Stockholm office is situated in Södermalm, the beating heart of the city’s game industry. It’s a physical representation of our games – the lush vegetation of Just Cause and theHunter: Call of the Wild meets corroded metal straight out of Mad Max. It has everything you need to make it your creative base camp.
   

  

**About Us**
 Avalanche Studios Group is a game developer and publisher that defined and evolved open-world games, offering an amazing portfolio of fantastic games across multiple genres, including the Just Cause franchise, Rage 2, theHunter: Call of the Wild, Generation Zero, and Second Extinction as part of its portfolio.
   

  

**Employee promise**
 We provide goals, instead of instructions, and the opportunity to do the best work of your career.
   

  

**Our Values**
 At Avalanche Studios Group, we believe in worlds beyond limits, and we are committed to developing a diverse and inclusive workplace. We are an equal-opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. Everyone at Avalanche Studios Group has a shared responsibility to create an open and inclusive work environment where everyone is treated equally and with respect. Being part of our world is not contingent on where you’re from, your gender, or sexual orientation. It’s all about your passion and creativity.
   

  

**How To Apply**
 We will only consider applications that consist of both a cover letter and a CV. In your cover letter, you should include why you want to work at Avalanche Studios Group. For this role, you need to be able to work from within our Stockholm Studio, alongside the strategic partnerships team. We apply a hybrid work model that enables you to work some days from home and some days from the office.

title: Release & Configuration Manager
company_industry: Civil Engineering, Software Development, and Financial Services
description:
**Release & Configuration Manager till ICA Sverige**
 ICA Sverige har påbörjat ett stort projekt för att implementera Infor M3 för vår partihandelsverksamhet och letar efter en engagerad Release & Config Manager för arbete med Infor M3 Cloud och ICAs interna miljöer. Vi står inför en mycket spännande framtid med implementation av nya arbetssätt och systemstöd inom främst order management, inventory management, warehouse management och finance.
   

  

**Om jobbet som Release & Configuration Manager**
 Som Release/Configuration Manager (RM/CM) hos oss har du ett övergripande ansvar för att koordinera och hantera konfigurationsversioner, data och integrationer för legacy-systemen, med fokus på M3-miljöer inför och under varje release-testcykel (SIT, UAT). I din roll planerar du tidsramarna för deployer, säkerställer att de följer fastställda releaseplaner och ansvarar för att kommunicera vilka deployer som sker i respektive miljö.
   

  

 Du driver också Cut-over-aktiviteter i samråd med andra parter och ser till att relevanta release notes är framtagna, samtidigt som du säkerställer smidiga övergångar mellan olika miljöer.
   

  

 Rollen täcker även GoLive-processen, där du ansvarar för den sista deployen och Cut-over till produktionsmiljön.
   

  

 Det betyder att du kommer att jobba med bla:
   

  

* Säkerställa att all godkänd konfiguration är sammanställd.
* Planering inför SIT/UAT där miljöerna är ”up to date” konfigurationsmässigt och sammankopplade på rätt sätt.
* Se till att SIT- och UAT-processerna genomförs
* Hantera releasekalendern och säkerställa att alla team är medvetna om kommande releaser
* Identifiera och hantera risker som kan påverka releaseprocessen.
* Dokumentera och kommunicera releaseplaner och statusuppdateringar.
* Implementera och förbättra releaseprocesser och verktyg.


 Utöver det, kommer du att också övervaka samtliga M3-applikationsreleaser, som släpps månadsvis.
   

  

**Är du den vi söker?**
 För att trivas i rollen, ser vi gärna att du har jobbat med liknande arbetsuppgifter i mer än 3 år och att du har högskoleutbildning eller motsvarande utbildning med relevant inriktning.
   

  

 Du kommer också behöva ta med dig:
   

  

* Förståelse för molntjänster som AWS, Azure eller Google Cloud Platform.
* Kunskap om konfigurationshantering och infrastruktur.
* Erfarenhet av ITIL-baserat ärendehanteringssystem för projektspårning som Atlassian.
* Erfarenhet av versionshanteringssystem som Git, SVN eller Mercurial.


 Vi söker dig som är kommunikativ, kvalitetsmedveten och noggrann. Du är utåtriktad och har stor förmåga att skapa och bibehålla både interna och externa relationer. Flexibilitet och förmåga att hantera flera uppgifter samtidigt är av stor vikt. Rollen kräver att du kan kommunicera bra med olika intressenter. Du har förmåga att arbeta väl i team och bygga starka arbetsrelationer samtidigt som du är en god ledare av dig själv och andra.
   

  

 För att vara aktuell för denna roll behöver du tala och skriva både svenska och engelska obehindrat.
   

  

 Läs mer om livet på ICA här.
   

  

**Vad händer nu?**
 Skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt, senast 25 oktober, då urval sker löpande. För frågor om tjänsten, kontakta rekryterande chef Georgios Savvidis, 010 4220745.
   

  

 ICA ska spegla våra kunder och samhället, vi strävar därför efter att anställa människor med olika bakgrund, kompetenser, kunskap och erfarenheter. Vi värnar om goda arbetsmiljöförhållanden med mål om helt rökfria arbetsplatser. Om roller kräver det så behöver du genomgå tester, bakgrundskontroller och drogtestning innan anställning.
   

  

 Läs mer om hur det är att jobba på ICA.

title: Frontend Engineering - Area Manager
description:
**Job Description**  

Do you like to lead technical teams in a global setup?  

Are you able to create a climate of cross functional collaboration where everyone is accountable and proud of the products and solutions?  

  

If yes - then we are hoping for you to join our team and lead our frontend engineering area for Portfolio Brands Engineering.  

  

Portfolio Brands Engineering is part of Business Tech within H&M group and support technical development for COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET, and Afound. We are on a journey to implement latest innovative solutions, offering seamless navigation, personalized recommendations, and an immersive browsing experience. We leverage advanced technologies to ensure a fast, secure, and user-friendly interface, allowing customers to explore our curated collections effortlessly. Our commitment to excellence drives us to continuously enhance our digital storefront and ensuring that our customers experience an exceptional online shopping journey.  

  

You will be part of a global network of frontend community and foster collaboration across sites and organizations. You will heavily support your colleagues in Portfolio Brands Engineering, as well as in other value streams of Portfolio Brands Product teams.

**Job Description:**  

As Area Manager, you will lead an engineering area for frontend and have formal staff responsibility for several Frontend Engineering Managers. Your org size will be about 40-50 engineers. You are responsible for building a strong engineering culture and designing Community of Practices for your area and to enable and secure a strong organizational health by securing that you plan for both deliveries as well as competence development. Within your area you will be responsible for recruiting, staffing, and retaining talents including having a healthy mix of consultants and employees in appropriate tech locations. As Area Lead Engineer you will be responsible to ensure that your Engineering Managers can staff initiatives in an efficient way according to set-goals – with a healthy work/life balance.  

  

**Responsibilities:**

* Acting as the employers extended arm to follow and implement H&M Group’s vision, goal, strategies, values, policies and processes, as well as acting as an ambassador, representing the management internally and externally
* Leading and steering an area with Frontend Engineering Managers and Frontend Engineers for a set of technology, software or platform development.
* Supporting your organization’s employee development
* Set objective and inspire team members based on specific competence needs
* Performance management and salary reviews
* Stay compliant with laws and policies, and act when necessary, in regard to e.g. underperformance, work environment, rehab cases etc.
* Recognize progress towards ambition and goal and required growth
* Budget responsibility for FTE & FTC budget
* Building a strong organizational health, role & competence development
* Recruitment and retention strategy for talents
* To establish a continuous learning & development activity within your area and contribute to an outside-in vision for competence development
* Stakeholder management
* Ensuring that your teams have a healthy mix of consultants and employees in the appropriate tech locations.

  

**Qualifications**  

* 7+ years as a technology leader using and implementing modern technologies in complex organizations at scale.
* Experience in front-end development with solid understanding of JavaScript, TypeScript, React, Next.js and related web technologies.
* Strong understanding of web performance optimization techniques and best practices.
* 4+ years of experience in managing a team of Software engineering managers or leading leaders in technology space.
* Great stakeholder management skills and collaboration across business units
* Interested in developing people and building an extraordinary engineering culture.
* Sound financial and forecasting skills and experience handling resource allocation budgets.
* Proven experience in building successful communities of practice.
* Cultivate trust and empower others to both responsibilities, dare to fail, learn, and grow.
* Strong interpersonal, collaborative, and communication skills.
* Ability and credibility to lead and guide both in-house and third-party teams.
* Outstanding troubleshooting, analytical, and problem-solving abilities

**Leadership Behaviors:**  

As a role model for our values and putting them into action, you are expected to demonstrate excellent cognitive, social, and emotional skills and know how to nurture them in others by having the ability to…  

... commit to directional decisions, take ownership of the whole and ,collaborate across boundaries.  

... communicate in a timely and perfect way.  

... strive for speed, reduce complexity, and focus on the outcome.  

… stay curious and be open to new perspectives.

 **Additional Information**  

For this position, we are primarily looking for candidates located in and around the Stockholm region to work in our **office in Liljeholmen.** We work from our office 2-3 days a week.  

  

**Are you the person we are looking for?** If your experience, skills, and ambitions are right for this role, please apply with CV in English.  

  

Questions about this recruitment process can be answered by Lead TA Partner - Nidhi Illman via nidhi.illman@hm.com  

  

**Benefits at H&M Group:**

* 6 weeks time off yearly and good work-life balance
* Special discount for our employees in all H&M stores and online worldwide.
* Collective Agreement and ITP pensions competitive to Swedish market
* Lots of additional perks and discounts from Benify for health and wellbeing
* Ample of focus groups to celebrate diversity and inclusiveness as well as our international culture and events.

**Inclusion & Diversity**  

At H&M Group, we’re determined to create and maintain inclusive, diverse, and equitable workplaces throughout our organization. Our teams should consist of a variety of people who share and combine their knowledge, experience, and ideas. Having a diverse workforce leads to a positive impact on how we address challenges, on what we perceive possible, and on how we choose to relate to our colleagues and customers all over the world. Hence all diversity dimensions are taken into consideration in our recruitment process.  

We strive to have a fair and equal process and therefore kindly ask you not to attach a cover letter to your application as it often contains information that can easily trigger unintentional biases.  

  

**Company Description**  

H&M Group is a family of brands; H&M, COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET, and Afound. At H&M Group, our people are the driving force behind our commitment to creating meaningful growth and more sustainable lifestyles. Help us re-imagine fashion and together we will re-shape our industry. Learn more about H&M Group here.
company_description: At H&M, we welcome you to be yourself and challenge you to grow and make a difference. Help us reimagine the future of an entire industry, making everyone look, feel & do good.

title: Chief Mine Planning Engineer to Boliden
description:
Boliden is a high-tech metal company with its own mines and smelters, committed to ensuring society’s supply of base and precious metals while striving to be world’s most climate-friendly and respected metal provider. Our work has been integral to the value chains that have shaped modern society for a century. The metals we mine and produce will play a crucial role in the future – it is how we produce them that matters. Join us in driving change for generations to come.  

Your opportunity:
Join our dynamic Mining Engineering Department, supporting Boliden mines in Sweden, Finland, and Ireland. We are at the forefront of innovation, solving complex problems, and implementing new technologies. As the Chief Mine Planning Engineer, you will play a pivotal role in shaping the future of our mining operations.  

Who you will work with:
You will lead a talented team within the Mine Planning section, collaborating with experts in Rock Mechanics, Mine Planning, and Production Technology. Our team is dedicated to excellence, working closely with various project leaders to ensure cohesive and effective project execution.  

What you will do:* Oversee and guide your team towards achieving both individual and organizational goals.
* Ensure that the team’s work meets quality standards and project deadlines.
* Mentor and develop team members, creating training plans and providing growth opportunities.
* Serve as a subproject manager/coordinator in feasibility studies, integrating mine planning into broader project goals.
* Collaborate with project leaders across disciplines for effective project execution.
* Provide operational support to mine sites, assisting with day-to-day activities.
* Refine and enhance current processes and routines, driving the development and implementation of new ones.
  

What you bring:* Strong leadership and management skills.
* Excellent communication and collaboration abilities.
* Proficiency in mine planning software (e.g., Datamine, Deswik).
* In-depth knowledge of mining processes, geology, and mineral economics.
* Ability to work under pressure and make strategic decisions.
* A University degree in mining engineering is a must, with at least 10 years of experience as a mine planning engineer in open pit and/or underground.
* Previous experience as a Chief Engineer or Team Lead is a merit.
* Professional designation in any jurisdiction (P.Eng, QP etc ) is a merit
* Proficiency in English, with Swedish being a merit.
* A Category B driving license.

This is a full-time, permanent position based in Boliden. Some business travel will be required. The starting date is subject to agreement.  

Why work with us:
Boliden offers an innovative and collaborative environment where you can shape our operations' future. We value initiative, creativity and the courage to challenge the status quo. As part of a forward-thinking team, you will be at the forefront of advancing our industry through automation and digitalization, contributing to both green metals production and overall profitability. Join us in driving the next phase of technological advancement.  

Apply today to be part of something truly meaningful!
Do you want to know more about the position? Contact Patrik Gillerstedt, Department Manager Mining Technology, patrik.gillerstedt@boliden.com. Do you have questions about the recruitment process? Contact Talent Acquisition Partner, Adam Martinez, adam.martinez@boliden.com.
Trade union information is available from Giovanni Cibrario, SACO, 070- 225 67 53, Andreas Mårtensson, Unionen, 070-541 83 93 or Peter Markström, Ledarna, 0910-77 40 09.
The last day to apply for this position is Tuesday the 12th of November.*If you are a representative of a recruiting firm, please refrain from contacting us about this* *posting**.* *We**appreciate**your**consideration**.*
-
Important! If you are a current employee within Boliden you shouldn't complete the application at this site, please log on to your Workday account and apply through "Find Jobs".

description:

* Driving and developing business with our key customers in Sweden and other Nordic countries
* Good overview of our portfolio of measurement and testing technology (systems, software, and hardware) and initiating regular customer visits, as well as the qualified answering of customer inquiries and needs
* Responsibility for the organization and implementation of the entire sales process, from the professional preparation of the offer and price negotiations to the sales conclusion and handover to the project management
* Coordination of detailed content with the respective experts and departments at the customer to address requirements in the course of the technical offer preparation by the account team in the best possible way
* Continuously develop strategic account management by carrying out market analyzes and setting corresponding market goals
* Participation in the preparation of quotations, monitoring of related tasks / deadlines and participation in the development of pricing concepts
* Preparation of business presentations, suggestions, documentation

**DIN PROFIL:**

  


* Successfully completed study in engineering or industrial engineering or have a comparable qualification
* 3+ years of relevant professional experience in a similar role

* Ideally, experience and a strong connection to e-mobility and test methods in the electrification context
* Strong communication skills, persuation/negotiating skills as well as confident and convincing appearance with a high level of service orientation in dealing with customers
* Solution-oriented work ethic to advance the business of our customers
* High level of personal responsibility, as well as excellent teamworking skills
* Willingness to travel abroad
* User level computer skills, CRM System knowledge (e.g. SalesForce)

* Driving license category B

  





**VI ERBJUDER:**

  


* Innovative and dynamic working environment

* An international environment with many opportunities to network with our colleagues around the globe

* Be part of our pioneering work– together with our customers we shape the future of mobility!

title: Senior Management Consultant - Finnish speaking
description:
We're Celonis, the global leader in Process Mining technology and one of the world's fastest-growing SaaS firms. We believe there is a massive opportunity to unlock productivity by placing data and intelligence at the core of business processes - and for that, we need you to join us.


**The Team:**



As a **Senior Management Consultant (Value Consultant)** you'll be joining our Nordics Value Engineering function, based in Copenhagen. This function is part of the wider Value Engineering organisation at Celonis. The position of Value Engineer is a trusted advisor helping customers achieve their strategic goals and realise significant value using the Celonis Process Intelligence Platform. A Value Engineer has full responsibility for the end-to-end value journey of our customers – landing, expanding, adopting and renewing. Responsibilities include translating customers’ objectives into value assessments or proof-of-value projects, building specific Celonis business cases and demos, running value workshops, and engaging with multiple senior stakeholders to deliver value driven results and secure long term partnership agreements.


**The Role:**



As a **Senior Management Consultant (Value Consultant)** you are spearheading our mission of data-driven business transformation with our customers. You will work in partnership with the Celonis Sales Teams and have full responsibility for the end-to-end value journey of our customers. You are our customers trusted advisor and help them achieve their strategic goals and realize significant value using Celonis EMS. In collaboration with our partners and Celonis Services, you will drive measurable business impact across various processes and industries and accelerate the adoption of our platform. You will blend deep process and industry expertise with a proven consulting skill set with strong analytical skills at the forefront of one of the fastest-growing tech companies worldwide.

  

**The work you’ll do:**


**Identify & Frame Value**


* Discover and translate customers’ strategic priorities into high-impact Celonis use cases
* Build demos and business cases, leveraging industry benchmarks and best practices in order to win new customers
* Undertake Value Assessments or Proof-of-Value Projects and communicate the value opportunity and strategic roadmap to C-Level executives


**Realize Value**


* Facilitate business value workshops and use Celonis to identify and qualify opportunities for process enhancement
* Derive improvement measures in core business functions and initiate improvement actions and enterprise-wide change initiatives
* Present results and realized value to senior management and C-level executives


**Scale Value**


* Responsible for the end-to-end customer value journey, landing, expanding, adoption and renewing
* Build a strategic expansion roadmap for customers embedding Celonis EMS as a strategic business transformation platform in their organization and therefore drive adoption and expansion
* Provide feedback to our product development teams to enhance the Celonis platform and Apps based on new use cases


**The qualifications you need:**


* **Live for Customer Value:** Several years experience in an analytical role with the objective to demonstrate or secure value through business data analysis / analytics, business process improvement and respective Software deployment . Ideally in a customer-facing role in Solution Consulting, Sales Engineering or IT/Management Consulting with a Software provider or a Consultancy. Alternatively in an inhouse role (e.g. Center of Excellence for Data Mining / Analytics / Intelligence) within an Enterprise
* **Data, Analytics, Applications & IT:** Good knowledge of Business Software applications and experience in using and/ or building dashboards, Apps and Action Flows. Experience in collaborating with IT teams  

**Process Improvement & Value Realization:** Experience in identifying use cases for business process improvement and deploying improvement measures, being a change agent and training users/process owners to realize value
* **Project Management:** Experience in planning and managing project scopes, expectations and timelines. You will manage multiple projects across your aligned accounts that will be at different parts of the value journey. Also, you will leverage partners from the Celonis Ecosystem wherever possible
* **Executive Stakeholder Management:** Experience in preparing and communicating (value) roadmaps and results to stakeholders and management, both internally and externally. Excellent communication and presentation skills in English and Danish
* **Business Domain Expertise:** Deep understanding of the Finance and/or Supply Chain domain as well as strategic transformation initiatives (e.g. Shared Services Transformation or System Transformation)
* **Industry Expertise**: Expertise in one or more industries (e.g. Manufacturing, Automotive, Consumer, Retail, Pharmaceuticals, Chemicals) and the ability to develop a deep understanding of industry trends and strategic opportunities
* **Degree:** in Technology & Management, Industrial/Business Engineering, Business Informatics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Economics or a comparable degree program


**What Celonis Can Offer You:**


* The unique opportunity to work with industry-leading process mining technology
* Investment in your personal growth and skill development (clear career paths, internal mobility opportunities, L&D platform, mentorships, and more)
* Great compensation and benefits packages (equity (restricted stock units), life insurance, time off, generous leave for new parents from day one, and more). For intern and working student benefits, click here.
* Physical and mental well-being support (subsidized gym membership, access to counseling, virtual events on well-being topics, and more)
* A global and growing team of Celonauts from diverse backgrounds to learn from and work with
* An open-minded culture with innovative, autonomous teams
* Business Resource Groups to help you feel connected, valued and seen (Black@Celonis, Women@Celonis, Parents@Celonis, Pride@Celonis, Resilience@Celonis, and more)
* A clear set of company values that guide everything we do: Live for Customer Value, The Best Team Wins, We Own It, and Earth Is Our Future

  


**About Us:**



Celonis helps some of the world’s largest and most esteemed brands make processes work for people, companies and the planet. With over 5,000 enterprise customer deployments across nearly every industry, the Celonis Process Intelligence Platform uses process mining and AI to give you a living digital twin of your business operation. It’s system-agnostic and without bias, and empowers companies to reduce waste, create value and benefit people across the top, bottom, and green lines. Since 2011, the Celonis platform has enabled its customers to identify more than $18 billion in value. Celonis is headquartered in Munich, Germany, and New York City, USA, with more than 20 offices worldwide.



Get familiar with the Celonis Process Intelligence Platform by watching this video.

  


**Equal Opportunity at Celonis:**



Celonis is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment and equal opportunity in all aspects of employment. We will not tolerate any unlawful discrimination or harassment of any kind. We make all employment decisions without regard to race/ethnicity, color, sex, pregnancy, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, transgender status, national origin, citizenship status, religion, physical or mental disability, veteran status, or any other factor protected by applicable anti-discrimination laws. As a US federal contractor, we are committed to the principles of affirmative action in accordance with applicable laws and regulations.

  


**Your Privacy:**



Any information you submit to Celonis as part of your application will be processed in accordance with Celonis’



Please be aware of common job offer scams, impersonators and frauds. Learn more here.

title: Verification engineer
description:
Transport is at the core of modern society. Imagine using your expertise to shape sustainable transport and infrastructure solutions for the future? If you seek to make a difference on a global scale, working with next-gen technologies and the sharpest collaborative teams, then we could be a perfect match.

**Shaping tomorrow's technology**
---------------------------------


At GTT, Vehicle Technology, we are passionate about shaping tomorrow’s technology to create excellent sustainable transport and infrastructure solutions to make the world a better place for future generations. We provide innovative, safe and driver-friendly solutions, we develop top quality services, and we make our customer operations more efficient by using excellent data insights. We support the Volvo Group engineering community with cutting edge tools and methods.

  

Do you want to use your expertise to shape sustainable transport solutions for the future? If you seek to make a difference on a global scale, working with next-gen technologies and the sharpest collaborative teams, then we could be a perfect match.

 **This is US :**

  

The group "Suspension Control System" within Vehicle Dynamics sub stream, residing in the "Vehicle Motion and Thermal Management" technology stream, is responsible for the development of the suspension control systems for all truck brands within Volvo Group as well as Volvo Bus. We are looking for a highly motivated engineer to strengthen our team in the Suspension Control software development area.

**Who are you?**
----------------


You have been creative with a mindset to learn and improve. As a part of an agile team, you are a team player and enjoy teamwork, but you are also able to work independently and drive development on your own. You have a good understanding of system development of embedded real time systems. Good Good communication and presentation skills both in text and verbally. You have a sense of responsibility with business and customer oriented. You most likely have a genuine automotive interest.

  

To be successful in this role, we believe that you have the following background and qualification :

  

* M.Sc. degree in Mechatronics, Control engineering, Computer Science, Electronics or similar.
* Good knowledge in Mechatronics, Mechanical engineering, Control engineering
* Familiar with tools such as CANoe, CANalyzer
* Tools used, CT Studio, GIT, Vector DaVinci, CANoe & CANalyzer, SystemWeaver(SE-TOOL), PN-tool
* Knowledge in C#, C++, Volvo Tools, architecture, ISO26262, Python are beneficial.
**What's in it for you?**
-------------------------


We are looking for a highly motivated engineer to strengthen our team in the Suspension Control SW Verification area.

  

As a verification engineer within our team, you will be one of the four focusing on verification. One part of the work will be to create test cases/scenarios on both ECU level (V3 SIL and HIL) and V5 system level for the suspension control system. The team is also responsible for regression testing and analysis of the result.

  

Since the team also includes function owners and SW developers you will be a closely involved in the SW development even though you will probably not write SW application code. You will perform tests in vehicles as well as tests in virtual environment. You will be an important member in an agile team, contributing to short term deliveries as well as long term strategies.

  

Key activities are:

  

* Test case/scenario creation
* Run and analyze regression results (mainly automated)
* Develop and continuously improve our verification strategy and way of working

  

In this role, you will report to Carl-Johan Rundqvist - Group Manager Suspension Control.

**Ready for the next move?**
----------------------------


Volvo Group believes in diversity, equity, and inclusion and offers a safe environment to grow. Use your open mind and can-do attitude to help us steer our transportation solutions toward a more sustainable tomorrow.

  

Come, join us as we take our solutions into a new era and make modern life possible. Let's drive progress together.

  

If you are interested in this position and want to know more you are welcome to contact Carl-Johan Rundqvist via email carl-johan.cr.rundqvist@volvo.com - or Arpitha BG - Talent Advisor at arpitha.bangalore.giri@consultant.volvo.com

  

We value your data privacy and therefore do not accept applications via mail.

 **Who we are and what we believe in**  

Our focus on Inclusion, Diversity, and Equity allows each of us the opportunity to bring our full authentic self to work and thrive by providing a safe and supportive environment, free of harassment and discrimination. We are committed to removing the barriers to entry, which is why we ask that even if you feel you may not meet every qualification on the job description, please apply and let us decide.

  

Applying to this job offers you the opportunity to join **Volvo Group**. Every day, across the globe, our trucks, buses, engines, construction equipment, financial services, and solutions make modern life possible. We are almost 100,000 people empowered to shape the future landscape of efficient, safe and sustainable transport solutions. Fulfilling our mission creates countless career opportunities for talents with sharp minds and passion across the group’s leading brands and entities.

 **Group Trucks Technology** are seeking talents to help design sustainable transportation solutions for the future. As part of our team, you’ll help us by engineering exciting next-gen technologies and contribute to projects that determine new, sustainable solutions. Bring your love of developing systems, working collaboratively, and your advanced skills to a place where you can make an impact. Join our design shift that leaves society in good shape for the next generation.

title: Automotive Diagnostic Engineer
description:
**Company Description**  

Are you looking for a company that offers a variety of assignments and gives you the chance to work with innovation and new technologies? With us at SEGULA Technologies, you will have the opportunity to work on exciting projects and help shape the digital domain while being supported towards your dream career. Skills development is a big part of SEGULA Technologies' DNA and we are always looking for new, ingenious and bold talents. Does this sound exciting? Join us on our journey in a fast growing international company.

 **Job Description**  

We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Automotive Diagnostic Engineer with specialized expertise in Vector tools to join our team. This role involves diagnosing, troubleshooting, and repairing complex vehicle systems, focusing on engine, transmission, and network communication issues using advanced diagnostic tools. The ideal candidate will have extensive knowledge of automotive electronics, CAN bus systems, and ECU failures, contributing to our commitment to providing high-quality service and repairs.

**Responsibilities may include, but not limited to:**

  

* Perform comprehensive diagnostics on vehicle systems, including engine, transmission, electrical, and in-vehicle network issues using Vector tools.
* Utilize Vector software and hardware (CANalyzer, CANoe, etc.) to troubleshoot communication faults, sensor issues, and ECU failures in modern vehicles.
* Analyze CAN bus and other network communications to identify faults and implement necessary repairs.
* Interpret diagnostic codes, wiring diagrams, and service manuals to effectively diagnose and repair faults.
* Document all diagnostic procedures, repairs, and software updates accurately, ensuring proper service records.
* Collaborate with other technicians and service advisors to communicate findings, recommend repairs, and ensure timely solutions.
* Stay current with updates on automotive diagnostic technologies and techniques, ensuring optimal performance and reliability of vehicle repairs.

  

**Qualifications**  

* B.Sc. and/or M.Sc. in Electrical engineer, computer science or equivalent
* Experience as an Automotive Engineer, specializing in vehicle diagnostics and troubleshooting.
* Strong proficiency with Vector tools, such as CANalyzer, CANoe, and related diagnostic software.
* In-depth understanding of automotive electronic systems, sensors, and vehicle network communications (CAN, LIN, etc.).
* Hands-on experience with ECU diagnostics, programming, and reprogramming.
* Ability to read and interpret wiring diagrams and service manuals.
* ASE certifications or equivalent automotive credentials are meritorious.
* Excellent English communication skills, both written and verbal
* Valid driver’s license.
* Swedish language skills are highly meritorious!

**Who are you?**


We believe you have strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to deliver accurate solutions promptly. We also see that you can effectively interact in both teams and with customers. Finally we see that you have an ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.

 **Additional Information**  

To thrive in this role we believe that you enjoy working collaboratively and that you are proactive in taking initiative. To apply for this position, you need to have a valid work VISA within the European Union. We embrace diversity and equality and attach great importance to your personal qualities. We are continuously recruiting, so welcome with you application today!  

  

*For questions or further information, please contact talia.brorsson@segulagrp.com*

title: Senior Data scientist/Machine learning engineer
description:
### **JOB DESCRIPTION**



Do you also want to make the world a little better while devoting yourself to cutting-edge technology development? Then Sigma Industry Development is the right company for you.



As a data scientist/machine learning engineer at Sigma Industry Development, you will:


* Design solutions for distributed computing to handle large datasets
* Develop domain expertise to better understand business problems and provide relevant solutions for the organization/client
* Creating clear and effective visualizations to present findings through visualizations and reports to non-technical stakeholders; communicating complex findings in a clear and understandable manner
* Collaborating with cross-functional teams, including business analysts, engineers, and decision-makers
* Applying critical thinking to frame and solve complex problems
* Adopting an iterative approach to problem-solving, refining models based on feedback
* Understanding and adhering to data privacy and ethical considerations
* Feature Engineering - Creating and selecting relevant features to improve model performance


And remember – besides the unlimited possibilities to engineer cutting-edge technology, you're an addition to our team; you become an integral part of the Sigma family, weaving your unique thread into the intricate tapestry of our company's path forward. Your presence holds the potential to shape our collective journey, infusing it with your skills and perspectives.



Welcome to the Sigma family. Your journey starts now, where each line of code etches a mark of your contribution on the canvas of our collective ambition.


### **BASIC QUALIFICATIONS**



**Education**



* M.Sc in Computer Science or Applied Physics/Mathematics


**Know-how**



* Data Analysis - Proficient in exploratory data analysis (EDA) to understand data patterns and trends.
* Statistical Modeling - Designing and implementing statistical models to derive insights from data.
* Hypothesis Testing - Conducting hypothesis testing to validate assumptions and make data-driven decisions.
* Programming Languages - Proficiency in programming languages such as Python or R for data manipulation and analysis; developing predictive models to forecast future trends and outcomes.
* Data Cleaning and Preprocessing - Cleaning and preprocessing raw data to prepare it for analysis.
* Data Wrangling - Manipulating and transforming data into a suitable format for analysis.
* Machine Learning and algorithm Selection - Selecting appropriate machine learning algorithms based on the nature of the problem.
* Model Evaluation - Evaluating model performance using metrics like accuracy, precision, recall, and F1-score
* Feature Engineering - Creating and selecting relevant features to improve model performance
* Hyperparameter Tuning - Optimizing model hyperparameters for better performance
* Big Data Technologies - Familiarity with big data processing tools like Hadoop and Apache Spark
* SQL and NoSQL Databases - Proficiency in working with both SQL (e.g., MySQL, PostgreSQL) and NoSQL (e.g., MongoDB) databases.


**Linguistics**



* Swedish and English (spoken and written)

### **PREFERRED ADDITIONAL SKILLS, PERSONAL TRAITS AND EXPERIENCE**



You embody the spirit of a passionate team player, adept at fostering positive interactions through exceptional soft skills. What sets you apart is your unwavering enthusiasm for both professional growth and enjoyment in the process. Just as we do, you believe that learning should be a journey of discovery and excitement.



If the realm of AI holds a special place in your interests, consider it an added advantage. We're thrilled at the prospect of delving into the world of artificial intelligence alongside you. Together, we'll nurture and cultivate these skills, turning curiosity into expertise, and evolving with the ever-changing landscape of technology.


### **WE OFFER**



Sigma Industry Development offers you a platform to shape your future. A company where you can excel in your career and simultaneously contribute to the greater good.



**Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) – a selection**



* https://starforlife.org/
* https://expectabettertomorrow.com/
* https://www.parasport.se/
* https://rfkhumanrights.org/leadership-council

**Our core values are**



* Family identity – have fun together and show appreciation.
* Teamplay – engage, learn, and give feedback.
* Gender equality & equal treatment – we are all the same: humans.
* Action – act to excel.


**In addition, Sigma offers a range of benefits**



* TGL Group Life Insurance
* Cellphone and subscription
* Additional life & accidents insurance
* Occupational Pension scheme
* Parental salary subsidy
* Wellness contribution
* Flexible working hours
* Hybrid workplace


Apply today if you like to know more about Sigma Industry Development.


### **MORE INFORMATION**



To apply – Register your resume via our website (link in add). The recruitment process is continuously ongoing.



For further information please contact, Oscar Silversparf (oscar.silversparf@sigma.se).

title: Agil produktägare till försvarsindustrin
description:
### **JOB DESCRIPTION**



**Är du utbildad ingenjör och intresserad av att vara med i utvecklingen av system inom försvarsindustrin?**



Som produktägare inom försvarsindustrin kommer du inte bara möta tekniska utmaningar, du kommer också ha möjlighet att utvecklas långsiktigt i en bransch som bidrar till säkerheten för samhället. Teknikstacken är stor och produkterna är komplexa, men det finns stora möjligheter att själv påverka lösningar och teknikval, samt ett stort utrymme för innovation.



Varje dag på jobbet kommer vara viktig och du kommer kunna göra skillnad för allas trygghet.



Söker vi dig?



För att fungera i rollen ser vi att du har en ingenjörsexamen inom relevant område såsom mekatronik, robotik, data, elektro- eller liknande


* Vi söker dig som inte bara vill arbeta med teknik, utan som vill vara med och skapa framtidens lösningar inom försvarsindustrin.
* Du är en lagspelare som gärna stöttar andra och delar med dig av din kunskap
* Du pratar och skriver på svenska och engelska
* Du är enbart svensk medborgare
* Minst 1 års erfarenhet agila projekt gärna som scrum master eller produktägare
* Kan vara på plats hos kunden i Karlskoga


Söker du oss?



Hos oss blir du välkomnad av glada och hjälpsamma kollegor. Vi har roligt på jobbet, högt i tak och ett engagerande klimat. Du står aldrig ensam inför en utmaning utan kan bolla idéer och hitta möjligheter tillsammans med dina kollegor.



Som konsult på Sigma ges du möjlighet att verka inom en rad olika branscher, där du antingen är på plats hos kund eller på Sigmas kontor via satellit- och in-houseprojekt. Vi har bland annat projekt inom fordonsindustrin, Life Science, låsindustrin, konsumentprodukter, livsmedel och elektrifiering. Vi bryter ständigt mark inom nya, spännande områden. Hos oss kan du hitta det just du brinner för lättare än på ett traditionellt företag.



Det finns mycket att berätta om Sigma Industry, våra värderingar och vår verksamhet. Kort och gott är ingenjören hjälten och vårt hjärta finns i tekniken. Vi driver digitalisering och deltar i utvecklingen av morgondagens teknologi. Sigma Industry är ett entreprenörsdrivet företag med stora visioner och korta beslutsvägar, vilket ger goda möjligheter att påverka såväl din egen som företagets framtid. Vill du bli expert inom ditt befintliga område, växa in i ett nytt eller engagera dig internt på Sigma? Möjligheterna är oändliga och hos oss får du allt i ett: en trygg anställning, en stimulerande vardag och en skräddarsydd framtid. Låter vi som en perfect match?



Läs gärna mer om vår verksamhet på sigmaindustryeastnorth.se



Vill du bli vår nya kollega?



**Vi ser fram emot att lära känna dig!**

Vi hoppas att du känner dig nyfiken på oss och vi ser fram emot att läsa din ansökan och ditt CV. Urval och intervjuer sker löpande så skicka in din ansökan redan i dag.



Kontakt



**Har du fler frågor? Hör av dig så berättar vi mer!**

title: Renewals Specialist
description:
AVEVA is a global leader in industrial software. Our cutting-edge solutions are used by thousands of enterprises to deliver the essentials of life – such as energy, infrastructure, chemicals and minerals – safely, efficiently and more sustainably.
We’re the first software business in the world to have our sustainability targets validated by the SBTi, and we’ve been recognized for the transparency and ambition of our commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion. We’ve also recently been named as one of the world’s most innovative companies.
If you’re a curious and collaborative person who wants to make a big impact through technology, then we want to hear from you! Find out more at AVEVA Careers.
For more information about our privacy policy and how to manage cookies, visit our Privacy Policy.
The Job
The Renewals Specialist is responsible for executing “volume renewal" transactions for the assigned markets or accounts. You are a subject matter expert on the commercial processes and practices. You engage with AVEVA sales team and customers through a systematic process to achieve renewal business metrics measured by renewal timing, renewal rate and renewal price. You maintain accurate account status details within salesforce and escalate observations to your line manager for resolution by other account stakeholders.  

Responsibilities:* Achieve renewal quota and renewal objectives such as on-time renewals and escalated contract renewals.
* Identify expansion opportunities and escalate the opportunities to the appropriate team to manage
* Responsible for renewals process from first contact to close for the assigned customers:
	+ Understand customer requirements
	+ Introduce customers to the renewal cycle/process
	+ Create and issue renewals quotations
	+ Forecast Renewals Opportunity status
	+ Track and expedite purchase orders
	+ Close renewals opportunities On-time
* Maintain accurate data in Salesforce.com regarding customer renewal information, renewal status and renewal reports.
* Provide process or quotation related support to Sales Account Managers and Customer Success Managers
* Other Duties may include:
	+ Support evolving renewal processes aimed at improving renewal efficiency
	+ Provide accurate reporting specifically for Late Renewals, Renewal migration and Churn including reasons for cancelation for analysis
	+ Assist Business with any other activity required to fulfil role


Skills & Qualifications:* Proficient knowledge and the application of renewal process, policies and pricing
* Experienced in customer facing administrative role, for example Sales Administrator, Customer support administrator or Marketing coordinator. Early career sales professional looking to gain solid experience of a volume business model.
* Put people first, working effectively with individuals and teams, customers and partners
* Plan ahead and work in a systematic and organized way.
* Focus on customer satisfaction and deliver a quality renewal customer experience.
* Commercially aware and business minded
* Get to the heart of complex problems and issues. Apply own expertise effectively for problem-solving.
* Communicate and network effectively.


Beneficial Skills & Qualifications:* Experience using Salesforce.com preferred

  

AVEVA requires all successful applicants to undergo and pass a comprehensive background check before they start employment. Background checks will be conducted in accordance with local laws and may, subject to those laws, include proof of educational attainment, employment history verification, proof of work authorization, criminal records, identity verification, credit check. Certain positions dealing with sensitive and/or third party personal data may involve additional background check criteria.  

AVEVA is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to being an exemplary employer with an inclusive culture, developing a workplace environment where all our employees are treated with dignity and respect. We value diversity and the expertise that people from different backgrounds bring to our business.  

  

Come and join AVEVA to create the transformative technology that enables our customers to engineer a better world.

title: Key Account Manager - Instrumentation and Test Systems
description:
**Key Account Manager - Instrumentation and Test Systems**
==========================================================

  

AVL List Nordiska works within Instrumentation & Test Systems on the Scandinavian market and have 30 employees in Gothenburg and Stockholm. For our Stockholm office we are looking for a motivated Key Account Manager to strengthen our local team. We offer a stimulating environment and a company culture where results, curiosity, learning and customer focus are key! If the responsibilities below attract you and you have the right profile please do not hesitate to apply.

  


**YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES:**

  


* Driving and developing business with our key customers in Sweden and other Nordic countries
* Good overview of our portfolio of measurement and testing technology (systems, software, and hardware) and initiating regular customer visits, as well as the qualified answering of customer inquiries and needs
* Responsibility for the organization and implementation of the entire sales process, from the professional preparation of the offer and price negotiations to the sales conclusion and handover to the project management
* Coordination of detailed content with the respective experts and departments at the customer to address requirements in the course of the technical offer preparation by the account team in the best possible way
* Continuously develop strategic account management by carrying out market analyzes and setting corresponding market goals
* Participation in the preparation of quotations, monitoring of related tasks / deadlines and participation in the development of pricing concepts
* Preparation of business presentations, suggestions, documentation
* Finding new domestic and international customers, keeping in touch

  





**YOUR PROFILE:**

  


* Successfully completed study in engineering or industrial engineering or have a comparable qualification
* 3+ years of relevant professional experience in a similar role
* Knowledge of development processes in the automotive environment
* Ideally, experience and a strong connection to e-mobility and test methods in the electrification context
* Strong communication skills, persuation/negotiating skills as well as confident and convincing appearance with a high level of service orientation in dealing with customers
* Solution-oriented work ethic to advance the business of our customers
* High level of personal responsibility, as well as excellent teamworking skills
* Willingness to travel abroad
* User level computer skills, CRM System knowledge (e.g. SalesForce)
* Language: Swedish and or/English both spoken and written.
* Driving license category B

  





**WE OFFER:**

  


* Innovative and dynamic working environment
* We support lifelong learning
* An international environment with many opportunities to network with our colleagues around the globe
* Collective Agreement and insurance
* Be part of our pioneering work– together with our customers we shape the future of mobility!

  





**Interested?**  

If so, please use our online application tool to send your application to AVL!


**About AVL**
-------------


AVL is one of the world’s leading mobility technology companies for development, simulation and testing in the automotive industry, and beyond. We provide concepts, solutions and methodologies in fields like vehicle development and integration, e-mobility, automated and connected mobility (ADAS/AD), and software for a greener, safer, better world of mobility.


Find out more: www.avl.com


**You are interested in a job at AVL but you are not sure how to apply or want to know what happens after you send your application?**
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

**Check out our step-by-step guide**


**AVL is not just about cars. It's about changing the future. Together.**
-------------------------------------------------------------------------

Stockholm, SE

title: Senior Value Engineer - Finnish speaking
description:
We're Celonis, the global leader in Process Mining technology and one of the world's fastest-growing SaaS firms. We believe there is a massive opportunity to unlock productivity by placing data and intelligence at the core of business processes - and for that, we need you to join us.


**The Team:**



As a **Senior Value Engineer** you'll be joining our Nordics Value Engineering function, based in Copenhagen. This function is part of the wider Value Engineering organisation at Celonis. The position of Value Engineer is a trusted advisor helping customers achieve their strategic goals and realise significant value using the Celonis Process Intelligence Platform. A Value Engineer has full responsibility for the end-to-end value journey of our customers – landing, expanding, adopting and renewing. Responsibilities include translating customers’ objectives into value assessments or proof-of-value projects, building specific Celonis business cases and demos, running value workshops, and engaging with multiple senior stakeholders to deliver value driven results and secure long term partnership agreements.


**The Role:**



As a **Senior** **Value Engineer** you are spearheading our mission of data-driven business transformation with our customers. You will work in partnership with the Celonis Sales Teams and have full responsibility for the end-to-end value journey of our customers. You are our customers trusted advisor and help them achieve their strategic goals and realize significant value using Celonis EMS. In collaboration with our partners and Celonis Services, you will drive measurable business impact across various processes and industries and accelerate the adoption of our platform. You will blend deep process and industry expertise with a proven consulting skill set with strong analytical skills at the forefront of one of the fastest-growing tech companies worldwide.

  

**The work you’ll do:**


**Identify & Frame Value**


* Discover and translate customers’ strategic priorities into high-impact Celonis use cases
* Build demos and business cases, leveraging industry benchmarks and best practices in order to win new customers
* Undertake Value Assessments or Proof-of-Value Projects and communicate the value opportunity and strategic roadmap to C-Level executives


**Realize Value**


* Facilitate business value workshops and use Celonis to identify and qualify opportunities for process enhancement
* Derive improvement measures in core business functions and initiate improvement actions and enterprise-wide change initiatives
* Present results and realized value to senior management and C-level executives


**Scale Value**


* Responsible for the end-to-end customer value journey, landing, expanding, adoption and renewing
* Build a strategic expansion roadmap for customers embedding Celonis EMS as a strategic business transformation platform in their organization and therefore drive adoption and expansion
* Provide feedback to our product development teams to enhance the Celonis platform and Apps based on new use cases


**The qualifications you need:**


* **Live for Customer Value:** Several years experience in an analytical role with the objective to demonstrate or secure value through business data analysis / analytics, business process improvement and respective Software deployment . Ideally in a customer-facing role in Solution Consulting, Sales Engineering or IT/Management Consulting with a Software provider or a Consultancy. Alternatively in an inhouse role (e.g. Center of Excellence for Data Mining / Analytics / Intelligence) within an Enterprise
* **Data, Analytics, Applications & IT:** Good knowledge of Business Software applications and experience in using and/ or building dashboards, Apps and Action Flows. Experience in collaborating with IT teams  

**Process Improvement & Value Realization:** Experience in identifying use cases for business process improvement and deploying improvement measures, being a change agent and training users/process owners to realize value
* **Project Management:** Experience in planning and managing project scopes, expectations and timelines. You will manage multiple projects across your aligned accounts that will be at different parts of the value journey. Also, you will leverage partners from the Celonis Ecosystem wherever possible
* **Executive Stakeholder Management:** Experience in preparing and communicating (value) roadmaps and results to stakeholders and management, both internally and externally. Excellent communication and presentation skills in English (Swedish is a plus)
* **Business Domain Expertise:** Deep understanding of the Finance and/or Supply Chain domain as well as strategic transformation initiatives (e.g. Shared Services Transformation or System Transformation)
* **Industry Expertise**: Expertise in one or more industries (e.g. Manufacturing, Automotive, Consumer, Retail, Pharmaceuticals, Chemicals) and the ability to develop a deep understanding of industry trends and strategic opportunities
* **Degree:** in Technology & Management, Industrial/Business Engineering, Business Informatics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Economics or a comparable degree program


**What Celonis Can Offer You:**


* The unique opportunity to work with industry-leading process mining technology
* Investment in your personal growth and skill development (clear career paths, internal mobility opportunities, L&D platform, mentorships, and more)
* Great compensation and benefits packages (equity (restricted stock units), life insurance, time off, generous leave for new parents from day one, and more). For intern and working student benefits, click here.
* Physical and mental well-being support (subsidized gym membership, access to counseling, virtual events on well-being topics, and more)
* A global and growing team of Celonauts from diverse backgrounds to learn from and work with
* An open-minded culture with innovative, autonomous teams
* Business Resource Groups to help you feel connected, valued and seen (Black@Celonis, Women@Celonis, Parents@Celonis, Pride@Celonis, Resilience@Celonis, and more)
* A clear set of company values that guide everything we do: Live for Customer Value, The Best Team Wins, We Own It, and Earth Is Our Future

  


**About Us:**



Celonis helps some of the world’s largest and most esteemed brands make processes work for people, companies and the planet. With over 5,000 enterprise customer deployments across nearly every industry, the Celonis Process Intelligence Platform uses process mining and AI to give you a living digital twin of your business operation. It’s system-agnostic and without bias, and empowers companies to reduce waste, create value and benefit people across the top, bottom, and green lines. Since 2011, the Celonis platform has enabled its customers to identify more than $18 billion in value. Celonis is headquartered in Munich, Germany, and New York City, USA, with more than 20 offices worldwide.



Get familiar with the Celonis Process Intelligence Platform by watching this video.

  


**Equal Opportunity at Celonis:**



Celonis is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment and equal opportunity in all aspects of employment. We will not tolerate any unlawful discrimination or harassment of any kind. We make all employment decisions without regard to race/ethnicity, color, sex, pregnancy, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, transgender status, national origin, citizenship status, religion, physical or mental disability, veteran status, or any other factor protected by applicable anti-discrimination laws. As a US federal contractor, we are committed to the principles of affirmative action in accordance with applicable laws and regulations.

  


**Your Privacy:**



Any information you submit to Celonis as part of your application will be processed in accordance with Celonis’



Please be aware of common job offer scams, impersonators and frauds. Learn more here.
